git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/39/130139/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from zaqar import context def inject_context(req, resp, params): """Inject context value into request environment. It also store the context info a threading local variable. :param req: request sent :type req: falcon.request.Request :param resp: response object :type resp: falcon.response.Response :param params: additional parameters passed to responders :type params: dict :rtype: None """ client_id = req.get_header('Client-ID') project_id = params.get('project_id', None) ctxt = context.RequestContext(project_id=project_id, client_id=client_id) req.env['zaqar.context'] = ctxt

commit_message:
Only enable one images filter button

Only one button for the images filter buttons should be enabled at any one time.
This is solved by removing the active class from all the filter buttons upon
selecting a filter.

Change-Id: I9d7753684f144a6d66ccc5b09f830b360a07a620
Closes-bug: 1365803

added_lines: // Remove active class from all buttons $(elm).find('div.table_filter button').each(function(index, btn) { $(btn).removeClass('active') })
deleted_lines: $(button).addClass('active');

commit_message:
Remove a redundant KeyPairsV3ClientJSON

There are duplicated KeyPairsV3ClientJSON settings in __init__()
of Manager class. This patch removes it.

Change-Id: Ia19e8db43d601c7ca919820c62da699e660e0623

commit_message:
Git should be a requirement

Seems obvious, but it throws non-obvious errors
when you try to import connection w/o git instaled

Change-Id: I47f9a5b79e1f17e352e63c61b71587d61276aca1

commit_message:
Sahara Cluster error state handling

If any Sahara cluster gets into Error state in benchmarks or context
the exception will be raised.

Sahara Cluster context is refactored to bring the wait method to the
class level.

Change-Id: Id437babd6d9e06c99481f2f62c02c2e95570cf81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/11/125311/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from rally import exceptions is_ready=self.all_clusters_active, def all_clusters_active(self, dct): for cl_id, client in dct.items(): cluster_status = client.clusters.get(cl_id).status.lower() if cluster_status == "error": raise exceptions.RallyException( "Cluster %s has failed to start" % cl_id) elif cluster_status != "active": return False return True
deleted_lines: def all_active(dct): for cl_id, client in dct.items(): cl = client.clusters.get(cl_id) if cl.status.lower() != "active": return False return True is_ready=all_active,

I added BaseWebElement, a base class for all web element objects,
i.e. both page objects and regions.

webelments as well, and used to be located within pageobject.
The necessity arose while discussing the regions patch
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102227/), that will be
modified accordingly by tnovacik.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Closes-Bug #1354017

commit_message:
Integration tests - BaseWebObject class

I added BaseWebObject, a base class for all web element objects,
i.e. both page objects and regions.
The new class now contains several wrappers for driver's
capabilities, which are required not only by the pages but other
webelements as well, and used to be located within pageobject.
The necessity arose while discussing the regions patch
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102227/), that will be
modified accordingly by tnovacik.

In addition, I've made 6 methods private, as they should
not be used outside the pages, definitely not by the tests.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Closes-Bug: #1354017
Closes-Bug: #1356774

Change-Id: Id65951160b2016cbdafd8417df48b1b5cd02f99f

The security groups RPC handler calls get_port_from_device
individually for each device in a list it receives. Each
one of these results in a separate SQL query for the security
groups and port details. This becomes very inefficient as the
number of devices on a single node increases.

This patch adds logic to the RPC handler to see if the core

commit_message:
Batch ports from security groups RPC handler

The security groups RPC handler calls get_port_from_device
individually for each device in a list it receives. Each
one of these results in a separate SQL query for the security
groups and port details. This becomes very inefficient as the
number of devices on a single node increases.

This patch adds logic to the RPC handler to see if the core
plugin has a method to lookup all of the device IDs at once.
If so, it uses that method, otherwise it continues as normal.

The ML2 plugin is modified to include the batch function, which
uses one SQL query regardless of the number of devices.

Closes-Bug: #1374556
Change-Id: I15d19c22e8c44577db190309b6636a3251a9c66a
(cherry picked from commit abc16ebfcf8fd1fbdb4ef68590140d4d355b0a7c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/72/132372/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_ports_from_devices(self, devices): port_ids_to_devices = dict((self._device_to_port_id(device), device) for device in devices) port_ids = port_ids_to_devices.keys() ports = db.get_ports_and_sgs(port_ids) for port in ports: # map back to original requested id port_id = next((port_id for port_id in port_ids if port['id'].startswith(port_id)), None) port['device'] = port_ids_to_devices.get(port_id) return ports
deleted_lines: def get_port_from_device(self, device): port_id = self._device_to_port_id(device) port = db.get_port_and_sgs(port_id) if port: port['device'] = device return port

commit_message:
Describes Ceilometer support for vCenter

Since 6.0 release supports Ceilometer for vCenter,
the limitation on using Ceilometer must be replaced with
the feature description and implementation details.

Change-Id: Id4399c54fa85b0ae3c703e2aba444223a6cc5708
Implements: blueprint ceilometer-support-for-vcenter
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/50/133450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Fuel can now install a Ceilometer agent on the Controller node where the Compute role is installed when deploying a vCenter environment. Operators can then configure Ceilometer to collect metrics for the vCenter environment; see :ref:`ceilometer-vcenter`. See the `Implement possibility to setup ceilometer compute agent on controller <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/ceilometer-support-for-vcenter>`_ blueprint for implementation details.
deleted_lines: .. note:: Fuel does not configure Ceilometer to collect metrics from vCenter virtual resources. For more details about the Ceilometer plugin for vCenter, see `Support for VMware vCenter Server <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Ceilometer/blueprints/vmware-vcenter-server#Support_for_VMware_vCenter_Server>`_

commit_message:
MOS can be used with NSX cluster that lacks Service nodes

- remove warning that says that NSX Service node is mandatory for
  Mirantis OpenStack
- add note about fact that NSX Service node is mandatory for high volume
  environments
- update screenshot with NSX settings block that shows new checkbox

Change-Id: I196f1b6353b8a64ba221d93f0622f6d3859dc9ea
Partial-bug: #1365043
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/26/127226/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Install NSX Service node (mandatory step for production NSX clusters)
deleted_lines: * Install NSX Service node .. note:: According to VMware documentation, an NSX cluster can operate successfully without an NSX Service node, but its presence is mandatory for deploying Mirantis OpenStack. Support of NSX clusters without a Service node might appear in future versions of Fuel.

subject: Reduce security group db calls to neutron server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-22 03:20:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_security_groups_rpc.py', 'neutron/agent/securitygroups_rpc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f9f694f95f5338d62f75ce54677dd165dc87a8d5', 'message': 'Reduce security group db calls to neutron server

Within ovs agent daemon loop, prepare_devices_filter will impose heavy workloads
to neutron server in order to retrieve the security groups message to apply
firewall rules. If agent is configured to use Noopfirewall driver or security
groups are disabled, there is no need for loading the rules from server and
refreshing the firewalls. This will reduce the number of db calls and improve
performance for neutron server in this case.

commit_message:
Reduce security group db calls to neutron server

Within ovs agent daemon loop, prepare_devices_filter will impose heavy workloads
to neutron server in order to retrieve the security groups message to apply
firewall rules. If agent is configured to use Noopfirewall driver or security
groups are disabled, there is no need for loading the rules from server and
refreshing the firewalls. This will reduce the number of db calls and improve
performance for neutron server in this case.

Change-Id: Id244aab3cac37fc6ed3dc05cbee91cdf9e34d9cc
Closes-Bug: #1365806
(cherry picked from commit 524981cce05a9b365036c0a1e9810036936d3d5b)

LOG.info(_LI('Disabled allowed-address-pairs extension.')) def skip_if_noopfirewall_or_firewall_disabled(func): @functools.wraps(func) def decorated_function(self, *args, **kwargs): if (isinstance(self.firewall, firewall.NoopFirewallDriver) or not is_firewall_enabled()): LOG.info(_LI("Skipping method %s as firewall is disabled " "or configured as NoopFirewallDriver."), func.__name__) else: return func(self, *args, **kwargs) return decorated_function @skip_if_noopfirewall_or_firewall_disabled LOG.info(_LI("Preparing filters for devices %s"), device_ids) LOG.info(_LI("Security group " "rule updated %r"), security_groups) LOG.info(_LI("Security group " "member updated %r"), security_groups) LOG.info(_LI("Provider rule updated")) LOG.info(_LI("Remove device filter for %r"), device_ids) @skip_if_noopfirewall_or_firewall_disabled def refresh_firewall(self, device_ids=None): LOG.info(_LI("Refresh firewall rules")) LOG.info(_LI("No ports here to refresh firewall"))

Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.

This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

added_lines: from tempest.common.utils import data_utils cls.network = cls.create_network() cls.subnet = cls.create_subnet(cls.network) cls.router = cls.create_router(data_utils.rand_name('router-'), external_network_id=cls.ext_net_id) cls.create_router_interface(cls.router['id'], cls.subnet['id']) cls.port = list() # Create two ports one each for Creation and Updating of floatingIP for i in range(2): cls.create_port(cls.network) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_list_show_floating_ip_by_admin_for_admin_tenant(self): # Creates a floating Ip _, body = self.admin_client.create_floatingip( floating_network_id=self.ext_net_id, tenant_id=self.network['tenant_id'], port_id=self.ports[0]['id']) created_floating_ip = body['floatingip'] self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_floatingip, created_floating_ip['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(created_floating_ip['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(created_floating_ip['tenant_id']) self.assertIsNotNone(created_floating_ip['floating_ip_address']) self.assertEqual(created_floating_ip['port_id'], self.ports[0]['id']) self.assertEqual(created_floating_ip['floating_network_id'], self.ext_net_id) self.assertIn(created_floating_ip['fixed_ip_address'], [ip['ip_address'] for ip in self.ports[0]['fixed_ips']]) # Verifies the details of a floating_ip _, floating_ip = self.admin_client.show_floatingip( created_floating_ip['id']) shown_floating_ip = floating_ip['floatingip'] self.assertEqual(shown_floating_ip['id'], created_floating_ip['id']) self.assertEqual(shown_floating_ip['floating_network_id'], self.ext_net_id) self.assertEqual(shown_floating_ip['tenant_id'], self.network['tenant_id']) self.assertEqual(shown_floating_ip['floating_ip_address'], created_floating_ip['floating_ip_address']) self.assertEqual(shown_floating_ip['port_id'], self.ports[0]['id']) # Verify the floating ip exists in the list of all floating_ips _, floating_ips = self.admin_client.list_floatingips() floatingip_id_list = list() for f in floating_ips['floatingips']: floatingip_id_list.append(f['id']) self.assertIn(created_floating_ip['id'], floatingip_id_list)

commit_message:
Improve performance of security group DB query

The _select_ips_for_remote_group method was joining the
IP allocation, port, allowed address pair, and security group tables
together in a single query. Additionally, it was loading all of
the port columns and using none of them. This resulted in a
very expensive query with no benefit.

This patch eliminates the unnecessary use of the port table by joining
the IP allocation table directly to the security groups and allowed
address pairs tables. In local testing of the method, this sped it up
by an order of magnitude.

Closes-Bug: #1373851
Change-Id: I12899413004838d2d22b691f1e2f3b18f7ec2c27
(cherry picked from commit 04df85b6e5a098f8f55bb82f04d9769763beb487)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/01/130101/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.db import allowedaddresspairs_db as addr_pair ips_by_group[remote_group_id] = set() # Join the security group binding table directly to the IP allocation # table instead of via the Port table skip an unnecessary intermediary models_v2.IPAllocation.ip_address, addr_pair.AllowedAddressPair.ip_address) # Outerjoin because address pairs may be null and we still want the # IP for the port. query = query.outerjoin( addr_pair.AllowedAddressPair, sg_binding_port == addr_pair.AllowedAddressPair.port_id) # Each allowed address pair IP record for a port beyond the 1st # will have a duplicate regular IP in the query response since # the relationship is 1-to-many. Dedup with a set for security_group_id, ip_address, allowed_addr_ip in query: ips_by_group[security_group_id].add(ip_address) if allowed_addr_ip: ips_by_group[security_group_id].add(allowed_addr_ip)
deleted_lines: ips_by_group[remote_group_id] = [] models_v2.Port, models_v2.IPAllocation.ip_address) query = query.join(models_v2.Port, ip_port == models_v2.Port.id) for security_group_id, port, ip_address in query: ips_by_group[security_group_id].append(ip_address) # if there are allowed_address_pairs add them if getattr(port, 'allowed_address_pairs', None): for address_pair in port.allowed_address_pairs: ips_by_group[security_group_id].append( address_pair['ip_address'])

commit_message:
Add pbr to installation requirements

Add pbr to the list of installation requirements so that it is installed
via pip before this library is installed, instead of with easy_install.
This avoids issues like Bug #1384919, and ensures that projects that use
this library as a dependency are properly installed.

Change-Id: I6c155370dbd01fe4748d5137bdf288e8d3e1a67e

subject: Cisco VPNaaS and L3 router plugin integration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-24 22:38:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f86aeff4b7e9e569e0c89ebb1f23752aad6e1f7c', 'message': 'Cisco VPNaaS and L3 router plugin integration

This completes the blueprint effort to integrate the Cisco VPNaaS
drivers with the Cisco L3 router plugin for a VPN solution that
uses an in-band Cisco CSR (versus out-of-band, as is currently).

The VPNaaS service driver is modified to no longer read router
configuration from an INI file, but instead, will query the L3
router plugin for this information. The config loading logic is
removed. The router information is transformed and passed to the
device driver for use by the REST client.

The L3 router plugin now provides two methods to provide the needed
router and hosting device info. In addition, the template and
snippets used to provision the Cisco CSR are modified to have the
needed VPN settings and to change the VRF configuration to the new
style to support VPN REST API calls with VRF info.

The VPNaaS device driver was modified to provide the VRF name as
part of the URI for several VPN REST API calls, as needed for this
solution. The device driver uses the additional VRF and interface
information that is provided by the service driver.

The unit tests were updated to reflect the usage of VRF names, and
the new logic for checking router information.

Change-Id: I6ee17f91a25db7bff3ebbeb8d482de1c31a77035
Implements: blueprint cisco-vpnaas-and-router-integration

drivers with the Cisco L3 router plugin for a VPN solution that
uses an in-band Cisco CSR (versus out-of-band, as is currently).

Implements: blueprint cisco-vpnaas-and-router-integration

commit_message:
Cisco VPNaaS and L3 router plugin integration

This completes the blueprint effort to integrate the Cisco VPNaaS
drivers with the Cisco L3 router plugin for a VPN solution that
uses an in-band Cisco CSR (versus out-of-band, as is currently).

The VPNaaS service driver is modified to no longer read router
configuration from an INI file, but instead, will query the L3
router plugin for this information. The config loading logic is
removed. The router information is transformed and passed to the
device driver for use by the REST client.

The L3 router plugin now provides two methods to provide the needed
router and hosting device info. In addition, the template and
snippets used to provision the Cisco CSR are modified to have the
needed VPN settings and to change the VRF configuration to the new
style to support VPN REST API calls with VRF info.

The VPNaaS device driver was modified to provide the VRF name as
part of the URI for several VPN REST API calls, as needed for this
solution. The device driver uses the additional VRF and interface
information that is provided by the service driver.

The unit tests were updated to reflect the usage of VRF names, and
the new logic for checking router information.

Change-Id: I6ee17f91a25db7bff3ebbeb8d482de1c31a77035
Implements: blueprint cisco-vpnaas-and-router-integration

commit_message:
Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.

This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

Change-Id: I077b9b2060e618823ef6dd6f95ce9fe7dcc52a06

for new instance port, and that event object contains

In this case nova will update new instance's info

commit_message:
fix event_send for re-assign floating ip

Neutron can associate a floating ip to a new port
without disassociate from original instance port.
This situation will send network changed event only
for new instance port, and that event object contains
the new instance's id.

In this case nova will update new instance's info
but not original one's in nova's database table
instance_info_caches. For nova can get new instance's
id from the above event. So in table instance_info_caches,
both original instance and new instance will have the
same floating ip in their records. And this make it
possible that, in most situation, after your re-assign
floating ip, run "nova list" will return incorrect info,
multiple instances have a same floating ip, and this may
confuse users.

Nova will sync data in table instance_info_caches, but it
may take dozens of seconds.
The new added code will send network changed event for the
original instance, and this will make nova update instance_
_info_caches table in a few seconds.

Change-Id: If3ee11535f649fc51bf1a52806008c1c5c0e73b6
Closes-Bug: 1381886
(cherry picked from commit add8944d4dba2a69e8f7da47f120d5dc63952f77)

commit_message:
Remove nosetest*.xml copy

Tempest is not using nose [1] and isn't producing this output.
Nothing in jenkins-job-builder config seems to want it as output.  I
think we can remove it.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-January/024673.html

Change-Id: I6d2fe9eddf4ee1df1cba81d4bd230ce46e3933c7

commit_message:
Remove neutron.common.rpc.RPCException

Remove RPCException, which was just mapped directly to
oslo.messaging.MessagingException for the purposes of minimizing the
impact to the code base when moving from openstack.common.rpc to
oslo.messaging.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: Idc5af503f24217fbd2d982c338434c200d025521

commit_message:
Run build_and_run_instance in a separate greenthread

If we're doing a lot of build operations, we are using a large portion
of the limited rpc worker pool for long periods of time. Since we may wait
on external services (like neutron or glance) during those times, we could
fully deplete that pool.

This patch makes us spawn a new greenthread for that task and return the
rpc worker to the pool. Due to some funkiness with the stack of decorators,
this breaks the inner function out to an object method, which is probably
good anyway, given its size. This also moves the wrap_instance_event
decorator to the inner function so that the start and stop events properly
demarcate the actual task and not just the (now very quick) RPC call.

Change-Id: Ife712c43c5a61424bc68b2f5ab47cefdb46ac168
Closes-Bug: #1372049
(cherry picked from commit 1d8eddb2614de8daaddddd64ad1a8de4c215fe7a)

LOG.debug(msg, instance=instance) return except exception.UnexpectedTaskStateError as e: LOG.debug(e.format_message(), instance=instance) return # b64 decode the files to inject: decoded_files = self._decode_files(injected_files) if limits is None: limits = {} if node is None: node = self.driver.get_available_nodes(refresh=True)[0] LOG.debug('No node specified, defaulting to %s', node, try: self._build_and_run_instance(context, instance, image, decoded_files, admin_password, requested_networks, security_groups, block_device_mapping, node, limits, filter_properties) except exception.RescheduledException as e: LOG.debug(e.format_message(), instance=instance) retry = filter_properties.get('retry', None) if not retry: # no retry information, do not reschedule. commit_message:
Move shib specific documentation

The generic 'configure federation' section has several references
to SAML and shib, we should move those to the shib specific doc.

Change-Id: Ie626a5039d33683c04cd964674ee2a9aab98c215

added_lines: identity properties issued by an external Identity Provider, such as SAML assertions or OpenID Connect claims.authentication to Keystone using identity properties. Keystone maps these values to Keystone user groups and assignments created in Keystone.* To use Shibboleth, follow the steps outlined at: `Setup Shibboleth`_. * To use OpenID Connect, follow the steps outlined at: `Setup OpenID Connect`_.
deleted_lines: SAML assertions issued by an external Identity Provider.authentication to Keystone using SAML assertions. Keystone maps the SAML assertions to Keystone user groups and assignments created in Keystone.Configure Apache HTTPD for mod_shibboleth ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Follow the steps outlined at: `Running Keystone in HTTPD`_. .. _`Running Keystone in HTTPD`: apache-httpd.html You'll also need to install `Shibboleth <https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/SHIB2/Home>`_, for example: .. code-block:: bash $ apt-get install libapache2-mod-shib2 Configure your Keystone virtual host and adjust the config to properly handle SAML2 workflow: Add *WSGIScriptAlias* directive to your vhost configuration:: WSGIScriptAliasMatch ^(/v3/OS-FEDERATION/identity_providers/.*?/protocols/.*?/auth)$ /var/www/keystone/main/$1 Make sure you add two *<Location>* directives to the *wsgi-keystone.conf*:: <Location /Shibboleth.sso> SetHandler shib </Location> <LocationMatch /v3/OS-FEDERATION/identity_providers/.*?/protocols/saml2/auth> ShibRequestSetting requireSession 1 AuthType shibboleth ShibRequireAll On ShibRequireSession On ShibExportAssertion Off Require valid-user </LocationMatch> .. NOTE:: * ``saml2`` may be different in your deployment, but do not use a wildcard value. Otherwise *every* federated protocol will be handled by Shibboleth. * The ``ShibRequireSession`` and ``ShibRequireAll`` rules are invalid in Apache 2.4+ and should be dropped in that specific setup. * You are advised to carefully examine `Shibboleth Apache configuration documentation <https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/SHIB2/NativeSPApacheConfig>`_ Enable the Keystone virtual host, for example: .. code-block:: bash $ a2ensite wsgi-keystone.conf Enable the ``ssl`` and ``shib2`` modules, for example: .. code-block:: bash $ a2enmod ssl $ a2enmod shib2 Restart Apache, for example: .. code-block:: bash $ service apache2 restart * Follow the steps outlined at: `Setup Shibboleth`_. * Follow the steps outlined at: `Setup OpenID Connect`_.

commit_message:
Allow LLA as router interface of IPv6 subnet

Although Link Local address is allowed to be set
as the gateway IP address of an IPv6 subnet when
force_gateway_on_subnet is set to False, it's not
allowed to attach IPv6 subnet to neutron router
when link local address is gateway IP.

This fix skips the check of if IP is inside subnet
when subnet is IPv6 and IP is Link Local.

Change-Id: I8623bfe5949808b0562ea9915fa6155a83fdc294
Closes-Bug: 1284518

revisions:

Currently the different OpenStack components don't delete
resources when tenants are deleted. For large, long-running
deployments this might become a severe issue.

 1/5 - Create the identity service plugin.

 2/5 - Delete tenants by calling out to the core
       and service plugins, deleting all resources in the right
       order. Resources are deleted breadth first if multiple
       tenants are to be deleted. Instead of deleting
       tenant by tenant, delete all ports by all tenants, and
       so on for every type of resource.

 3/5 - Discover tenants that have resources in Neutron, that
       don't exist in Keystone.

 4/5 - Introduce a command line utility that executes code from
       patches 2 & 3. The utility calls out to the discovery
       functionality in the identity service plugin and persists
       the list of tenants to be deleted to disk. It can also
       pass that list to the delete function.

*5/5 - Respond to Keystone RPC notifications about tenant deletion.

DocImpact

commit_message:
[5/5] Clean up Neutron resources upon tenant deletion

Currently the different OpenStack components don't delete
resources when tenants are deleted. For large, long-running
deployments this might become a severe issue.

 1/5 - Create the identity service plugin.

 2/5 - Delete tenants by calling out to the core
       and service plugins, deleting all resources in the right
       order. Resources are deleted breadth first if multiple
       tenants are to be deleted. Instead of deleting
       tenant by tenant, delete all ports by all tenants, and
       so on for every type of resource.

 3/5 - Discover tenants that have resources in Neutron, that
       don't exist in Keystone.

 4/5 - Introduce a command line utility that executes code from
       patches 2 & 3. The utility calls out to the discovery
       functionality in the identity service plugin and persists
       the list of tenants to be deleted to disk. It can also
       pass that list to the delete function.

*5/5 - Respond to Keystone RPC notifications about tenant deletion.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #967832
Implements: blueprint tenant-delete

commit_message:
WIP Refactor l2_pop code in linuxbridge

A previous refactor introduced a namedtupled for sending ip and mac
address information for a port instead of a regular tuple.  This
commit will take advantage of that to break the position dependence of
the code in linuxbridge which uses that information for
maintainability.  It will also add a little bit of readability to the
code.

Change-Id: I1069c69990ddc394c195f39f23284b02fb7af560

commit_message:
Fix removal of unique constraint in database

In order to deal with the peculiar index handling in mysql,
which would lead to operational error 1553, this patch first
drop a foreign key on one of the unique constraint field,
and the creates it again once the constraint has been removed.

Change-Id: Iba0ce58de77e8fa1ff12cf7b972a45babb3b8936
Closes-Bug: #1354195

revisions:

~/code/neutron$ tox -v -epy27 neutron.tests.unit.bigswitch

commit_message:
WIP: Add ability to cache plugins between tests

Don't force the plugin to be deallocated for every test if
not necessary.

It's common for all of the tests in a testcase class to use
the same plugin without each requiring a fresh initialization
of the plugin before the test. This is an experimental patch
to have the ability to cache the plugin between tests.

Some preliminary testing after enabling for some of the Big Switch
unit tests:
~/code/neutron$ tox -v -epy27 neutron.tests.unit.bigswitch
Before: Ran 503 tests in 75.237s
After: Ran 503 tests in 70.677s

Given the increased complexity, it may not be worth the ~6% time
reduction.

Change-Id: I7afc2409c36dd96601ab76ea745769a19b9cf04b

commit_message:
Adds optional timeout for neutronclient

The neutronclient used by the neutron agents does not set a
timeout on its connection socket. This patch adds a new
client_http_timeout config option to allow admins to set a
non-default timeout value for neutronclient connections.

If no value or zero is provided, the existing default is
used which is currently no timeout at all.

Change-Id: Id5075f3c2299a4ad491f4f81b6dbd5be8bf4898f
Closes-bug: 1259575
DocImpact: new client_http_timeout option
Co-authored-by: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>

commit_message:
Add per-haproxy process logging

Currently, in certain syslog configurations (in which emergency-level
logs are broadcasted to all users), haproxy might spam an error message
to all logged in user. This proposed change adds a new "logs" file
which can be found in the state_path directory. Whenever haproxy sends
a log message via the syslog library, it is instead sent to the
lbaas-agent, which in turns dumps it to a file.

Closes-bug: #1362213
Change-Id: Ibef6e71f5139ecf5a60606d0f1e4811ffb41b72c

commit_message:
Fixes agent securitygroups_rpc is_firewall_enabled issue

The function should return False if not _is_valid_driver_combination.
Otherwise, it could return True in a case it shouldn't:
cfg.CONF.SECURITYGROUP.firewall_driver =
'neutron.agent.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver'
cfg.CONF.SECURITYGROUP.enable_security_group = True

The function now returns False if _is_valid_driver_combination is
False as expected.

Closes-Bug: #1367229

Change-Id: Ib7e1e13f3d2d15a1ac4600680e0b3c1cc9d51ce8

commit_message:
Fix incorrect 'allow_put' in security_group_rules

security_group_rules direction had 'allow_put': True which
suggested that it can be updated while it is not possible.

Closes-Bug: #1366719

Change-Id: I7078d7d0285352f01933fdbab2cefcec9ceb19b0

commit_message:
OVS-Agent crashes when OVS dead(Alternative II)

Alternative patch of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/110538/
(Just for reference, and this line will be removed before merge.)
OVS crash/restart is unpredictable, so neutron-ovs-agent should be
robust enough under that situation. But currently ovs-agent doesn't
figure out this error status(only check ovs restarted status) and
still continue to apply subsequent opreations(set br/add patch
port/...) till causing exceptions/crash. Add proper fail-over code
to treat ovs dead/restart graceful, to prevent agent crash while it
is running.

Closes-bug: #1296202
Change-Id: I911bd8862cee1928c1450704a6e1b252f3e609af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/50/113450/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: canary_flow = None while canary_flow is None: # Check for the canary flow canary_flow = self.int_br.dump_flows_for_table( constants.CANARY_TABLE) if canary_flow == '': LOG.debug(_("OVS is restarted. Rest bridges and " "recover ports.")) return True elif canary_flow is None: LOG.error(_("OVS is dead. OVSNeutronAgent keeps running " "and detecting ovs status periodically. ")) # Agent doesn't apply any operations till ovs is alive, # to prevent unexpected failure or crash. time.sleep(self.polling_interval) else: # OVS is in normal status return False
deleted_lines: # Check for the canary flow canary_flow = self.int_br.dump_flows_for_table(constants.CANARY_TABLE) return not canary_flow

commit_message:
Log error for failed update_device|(up/down)

Previously, we log these failures at debug level but these should be logged
at the error level as if we fail to update the port_status value it can
cause nova to not starting the vm.

Closes-bug: 1357593

Change-Id: I1c393125b3418a7385ce504c95b4113823a7c440

commit_message:
Update metering agent with correct list of routers

Metering agent can collect statistics only from routers scheduled
at the same node. The list of routers is filtered by L3 agent,
but due to code error all routers were returned causing traces.
The patch fixes DB filtering and update in agent.

Closes bug 1286209

Change-Id: I608d2010b696fa52ac42d71d40272843e90549d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/21/118321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for label, router in labels: router_dict = routers_dict.get(router['id'], self._make_router_dict(router)) rules = self._get_metering_rules_dict(label) data = {'id': label['id'], 'rules': rules} router_dict[constants.METERING_LABEL_KEY].append(data) routers_dict[router['id']] = router_dict labels = context.session.query(MeteringLabel, l3_db.Router)
deleted_lines: for label in labels: routers = label.routers for router in routers: router_dict = routers_dict.get( router['id'], self._make_router_dict(router)) rules = self._get_metering_rules_dict(label) data = {'id': label['id'], 'rules': rules} router_dict[constants.METERING_LABEL_KEY].append(data) routers_dict[router['id']] = router_dict labels = context.session.query(MeteringLabel)

commit_message:
Support for DFA Overlay Type Driver

This patch implements DFA overlay type driver and its related changes
with Unit Tests. This is needed for Cisco's Dynamic Fabric Automation
(DFA). This is part 3 of blueprint vdp-network-overlay implementation

Change-Id: I8387fa00b2c041305697d51412e24054b67b7545
Partially Implements: blueprint vdp-network-overlay

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Cisco Systems # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # @author: Nader Lahouti, Cisco Systems, Inc. # @author: Padmanabhan Krishnan, Cisco Systems, Inc. """This file is created based on type_vlan.py with some modification to handle segmentation id allocation when network type is Cisco DFA. The segmentation id allocated by driver does not have 4k limitiation in vlan type driver. The DFA network supports more than 4k segmentation id. """ from oslo.config import cfg from six import moves import sqlalchemy as sa from neutron.common import exceptions as exc from neutron.db import api as db_api from neutron.db import model_base from neutron.openstack.common import log from neutron.plugins.common import constants as p_const from neutron.plugins.common import utils as plugin_utils from neutron.plugins.ml2 import driver_api as api from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.cisco.dfa import constants as dfa_const from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers import helpers LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) cisco_dfa_opts = [ cfg.ListOpt('cisco_dfa_segment_ranges', default=[], help=_("List of <physical_network>:<segment_id_min>:" "<segment_id_max>")) ] cfg.CONF.register_opts(cisco_dfa_opts, "ml2_type_cisco_dfa_overlay") class CiscoDfaSegmentAllocation(model_base.BASEV2): """Represent allocation state of a segment_id on a physical network. If allocated is False, the segment_id on the physical_network is available for allocation to a tenant network. If allocated is True, the segment_id on the physical_network is in use, either as a tenant or provider network. When an allocation is released, if the segment_id for the physical_network is inside the pool described by DfaTypeDriver.network_segment_ranges, then allocated is set to False. If it is outside the pool, the record is deleted. """ __tablename__ = 'ml2_cisco_dfa_segment_allocations' physical_network = sa.Column(sa.String(64), nullable=False, primary_key=True) segment_id = sa.Column(sa.Integer, nullable=False, primary_key=True, autoincrement=False) allocated = sa.Column(sa.Boolean, nullable=False) class CiscoDfaOverlayTypeDriver(helpers.TypeDriverHelper): """Manage state for DFA Network with ML2. The CiscoDfaOverlayTypeDriver implements the 'DFA' network_type. """ def __init__(self): super(CiscoDfaOverlayTypeDriver, self).__init__(CiscoDfaSegmentAllocation) try: self._parse_cisco_dfa_segment_ranges() except exc.InvalidConfigurationOption: raise SystemExit(1) def _parse_cisco_dfa_segment_ranges(self): try: cfg_range = (cfg.CONF.ml2_type_cisco_dfa_overlay. cisco_dfa_segment_ranges) seg_ranges = plugin_utils.parse_network_segment_ranges( cfg.CONF.ml2_type_cisco_dfa_overlay. cisco_dfa_segment_ranges) self.cisco_dfa_segment_ranges = seg_ranges except Exception: LOG.exception(_("Failed to parse cisco_dfa_segment_ranges. " "Service terminated!")) raise exc.InvalidConfigurationOption(opt_name= "cisco_dfa_segment_ranges", opt_value=cfg_range) imsg = (_("DFA segment ranges: %s") % self.cisco_dfa_segment_ranges) LOG.info(imsg) def _sync_cisco_dfa_segment_allocations(self): session = db_api.get_session() with session.begin(subtransactions=True): # get existing allocations for all physical networks allocations = dict() allocs = (session.query(CiscoDfaSegmentAllocation). with_lockmode('update')) for alloc in allocs: if alloc.physical_network not in allocations: allocations[alloc.physical_network] = set() allocations[alloc.physical_network].add(alloc) # process segment ranges for each configured physical network for (physical_network, seg_id_ranges) in self.cisco_dfa_segment_ranges.items(): # determine current configured allocatable segments for # this physical network segment_ids = set() for seg_id_min, seg_id_max in seg_id_ranges: segment_ids |= set(moves. xrange(seg_id_min, seg_id_max + 1)) # remove from table unallocated segments not currently # allocatable if physical_network in allocations: for alloc in allocations[physical_network]: try: # see if segment id is allocatable segment_ids.remove(alloc.segment_id) except KeyError: # it's not allocatable, so check if its allocated if not alloc.allocated: # it's not, so remove it from table LOG.debug("Removing segment id %(seg_id)s on" " physical network " "%(physical_network)s from pool", {'seg_id': alloc.segment_id, 'physical_network': physical_network}) session.delete(alloc) del allocations[physical_network] # add missing allocatable segment id to table for seg_id in sorted(segment_ids): alloc = CiscoDfaSegmentAllocation(physical_network= physical_network, segment_id=seg_id, allocated=False) session.add(alloc) # remove from table unallocated segment ids for any unconfigured # physical networks for allocs in allocations.itervalues(): for alloc in allocs: if not alloc.allocated: LOG.debug("Removing segment %(seg_id)s on physical " "network %(physical_network)s from pool", {'seg_id': alloc.segment_id, 'physical_network': alloc.physical_network}) session.delete(alloc) def get_type(self): return dfa_const.TYPE_CISCO_DFA_OVERLAY def initialize(self): self._sync_cisco_dfa_segment_allocations() LOG.info(_("CiscoDfaOverlayTypeDriver initialization complete")) def is_partial_segment(self, segment): return segment.get(api.SEGMENTATION_ID) is None def validate_provider_segment(self, segment): physical_network = segment.get(api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK) segmentation_id = segment.get(api.SEGMENTATION_ID) if physical_network: if physical_network not in self.cisco_dfa_segment_ranges: msg = (_("physical_network '%s' unknown for provider network") % physical_network) raise exc.InvalidInput(error_message=msg) elif segmentation_id: msg = _("segmentation_id requires physical network for " "Cisco DFA provider network") raise exc.InvalidInput(error_message=msg) for key, value in segment.items(): if value and key not in [api.NETWORK_TYPE, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK, api.SEGMENTATION_ID]: msg = _("%s prohibited for Cisco DFA network") % key raise exc.InvalidInput(error_message=msg) def reserve_provider_segment(self, session, segment): filters = {} physical_network = segment[api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK] if physical_network is not None: filters['physical_network'] = physical_network segment_id = segment[api.SEGMENTATION_ID] if segment_id is not None: filters['segment_id'] = segment_id if self.is_partial_segment(segment): alloc = self.allocate_partially_specified_segment( session, **filters) if not alloc: raise exc.NoNetworkAvailable else: alloc = self.allocate_fully_specified_segment( session, **filters) if not alloc: raise exc.SegmentIdInUse(**filters) # Revisit after hierarchical port binding is merged. TODO(padkrish) return {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VDP_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: alloc.physical_network, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: alloc.segment_id} def allocate_tenant_segment(self, session): with session.begin(subtransactions=True): alloc = self.allocate_partially_specified_segment(session) if not alloc: return return {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VDP_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: alloc.physical_network, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: alloc.segment_id} def release_segment(self, session, segment): physical_network = segment[api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK] segment_id = segment[api.SEGMENTATION_ID] ranges = self.cisco_dfa_segment_ranges.get(physical_network, []) inside = any(lo <= segment_id <= hi for lo, hi in ranges) with session.begin(subtransactions=True): query = (session.query(CiscoDfaSegmentAllocation). filter_by(physical_network=physical_network, segment_id=segment_id)) if inside: count = query.update({"allocated": False}) if count: LOG.debug("Releasing segment %(seg_id)s on physical " "network %(physical_network)s to pool", {'seg_id': segment_id, 'physical_network': physical_network}) else: count = query.delete() if count: LOG.debug("Releasing segment %(seg_id)s on physical " "network %(physical_network)s outside pool", {'seg_id': segment_id, 'physical_network': physical_network}) if not count: LOG.warning(_("No segment_id %(seg_id)s found on physical " "network %(physical_network)s"), {'seg_id': segment_id, 'physical_network': physical_network})

commit_message:
Avoid calling delete_port() from within a transaction

delete_floatingip method still calls delete_port() from
transaction which might cause issues with lock wait timeouts
for mysql.

Change-Id: I788adf6a5e432b962df85f92f2859eda35bfcd50
Closes-Bug: #1332577

subject: fix event_send for re-assign floating ip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-12 15:58:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/notifiers/nova.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/notifiers/test_notifiers_nova.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/70fb84390d130514b47b5704802c0c3f30739f2c', 'message': 'fix event_send for re-assign floating ip

Neutron can associate a floating ip to a new port
without disassociate from original instance port.
This situation will send network changed event only
for new instance port, and that event object contains
the new instance's id.

In this case nova will update new instance's info
but not original one's in nova's database table
instance_info_caches. For nova can get new instance's
id from the above event. So in table instance_info_caches,
both original instance and new instance will have the
same floating ip in their records. And this make it
possible that, in most situation, after your re-assign
floating ip, run "nova list" will return incorrect info,
multiple instances have a same floating ip, and this may
confuse users.

Nova will sync data in table instance_info_caches, but it
may take dozens of seconds.
The new added code will send network changed event for the
original instance, and this will make nova update instance_
_info_caches table in a few seconds.

Change-Id: If3ee11535f649fc51bf1a52806008c1c5c0e73b6
Closes-Bug: 1381886
(cherry picked from commit add8944d4dba2a69e8f7da47f120d5dc63952f77)
'}]
commit_message:
fix event_send for re-assign floating ip

Neutron can associate a floating ip to a new port
without disassociate from original instance port.
This situation will send network changed event only
for new instance port, and that event object contains
the new instance's id.

In this case nova will update new instance's info
but not original one's in nova's database table
instance_info_caches. For nova can get new instance's
id from the above event. So in table instance_info_caches,
both original instance and new instance will have the
same floating ip in their records. And this make it
possible that, in most situation, after your re-assign
floating ip, run "nova list" will return incorrect info,
multiple instances have a same floating ip, and this may
confuse users.

Nova will sync data in table instance_info_caches, but it
may take dozens of seconds.
The new added code will send network changed event for the
original instance, and this will make nova update instance_
_info_caches table in a few seconds.

Change-Id: If3ee11535f649fc51bf1a52806008c1c5c0e73b6
Closes-Bug: 1381886
(cherry picked from commit add8944d4dba2a69e8f7da47f120d5dc63952f77)

added_lines: def test_reassociate_floatingip_without_disassociate_event(self): returned_obj = {'floatingip': {'port_id': 'f5348a16-609a-4971-b0f0-4b8def5235fb'}} original_obj = {'port_id': '5a39def4-3d3f-473d-9ff4-8e90064b9cc1'} self.nova_notifier._waiting_to_send = True self.nova_notifier.send_network_change( 'update_floatingip', original_obj, returned_obj) self.assertEqual(2, len(self.nova_notifier.pending_events)) returned_obj_non = {'floatingip': {'port_id': None}} event_dis = self.nova_notifier.create_port_changed_event( 'update_floatingip', original_obj, returned_obj_non) event_assoc = self.nova_notifier.create_port_changed_event( 'update_floatingip', original_obj, returned_obj) self.assertEqual(self.nova_notifier.pending_events[0], event_dis) self.assertEqual(self.nova_notifier.pending_events[1], event_assoc)

commit_message:
Don't report about 100% provisioning status twice

Do not report to Nailgun that status of provisioning
on all nodes is 100%, because it cancels sending
of 'provisioning task is ready' message.

Change-Id: I0f677bd743413d68a98a4c817fa3694d28f57ef8
Closes-bug: #1392462

commit_message:
Create a discoverable plugin

Move the version detection code into a plugin because it
does not belong in connection.  Create a new discoverable plugin
that looks at the auth_url and makes a best guess if it should
use v2 or v3 auth.

The plugin also now accepts access_info so a cached version
of the authorization can be reproduced without hitting
keystone.

Change-Id: Ia5d32457c90716627a75be2c99267c4ed7903197

commit_message:
ConductorManager catches Exceptions

The drivers should only be raising IronicExceptions (or NotImplementedError
for sensor and boot-device related management methods) now. However, we
cannot guarantee that all the drivers will only raise IronicExceptions
forever, so the ConductorManager should continue to catch all Exceptions,
not just IronicExceptions.

This removes the TODO comments about only catching IronicExceptions.

Change-Id: I80ef323b159633ab8052ccb75af6f69ff26143ef

subject: _update_router_db: don't hold open transactions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-27 16:13:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a575cb7cb6c30d843c3ac824e5f2f11a5055a9fb', 'message': "_update_router_db: don't hold open transactions

This patch prevents the L3 _update_router_db method from
starting a transaction before calling the gateway interface
removal functions. With these port changes now occuring
outside of the L3 DB transaction, a failure to update the
router DB information will not rollback the port deletion
operation.

The 'VPN in use' check had to be moved inside of the DB deletion
transaction now that there isn't an enclosing transaction to undo
the delete when an 'in use' error is raised.

===Details===

The router update db method starts a transaction and calls
the gateway update method with the transaction held open.
This becomes a problem when the update results in an
interface removal which uses a port table lock.

Because the delete_port caller is still holding open a
transaction, other sessions are blocked from getting an
SQL lock on the same tables when delete_port starts
performing RPC notifications, external controller calls,
etc. During those external calls, eventlet will
yield and another thread may try to get a lock on the
port table, causing the infamous mysql/eventlet deadlock.

This separation of L2/L3 transactions is similiar to change
I3ae7bb269df9b9dcef94f48f13f1bde1e4106a80 in nature. Even
though there is a loss in the atomic behavior of the interface
removal operation, it was arguably incorrect to begin with.
The restoration of port DB records during a rollback after some
other failure doesn't undo the backend operations (e.g. REST calls)
that happened during the original deletion. So, having a delete
rollback without corresponding 'create_port' calls to the backend
causes a loss in consistency.

Conflicts:

	neutron/db/l3_db.py

Closes-Bug: #1377241
Change-Id: I5fdb6b24bf2fb80ac5e36a742aa7056db72c8c7d
(cherry picked from commit f23f2ecee68ba4abd12139bbb91b77ba9410f581)

commit_message:
_update_router_db: don't hold open transactions

This patch prevents the L3 _update_router_db method from
starting a transaction before calling the gateway interface
removal functions. With these port changes now occuring
outside of the L3 DB transaction, a failure to update the
router DB information will not rollback the port deletion
operation.

The 'VPN in use' check had to be moved inside of the DB deletion
transaction now that there isn't an enclosing transaction to undo
the delete when an 'in use' error is raised.

===Details===

The router update db method starts a transaction and calls
the gateway update method with the transaction held open.
This becomes a problem when the update results in an
interface removal which uses a port table lock.

Because the delete_port caller is still holding open a
transaction, other sessions are blocked from getting an
SQL lock on the same tables when delete_port starts
performing RPC notifications, external controller calls,
etc. During those external calls, eventlet will
yield and another thread may try to get a lock on the
port table, causing the infamous mysql/eventlet deadlock.

This separation of L2/L3 transactions is similiar to change
I3ae7bb269df9b9dcef94f48f13f1bde1e4106a80 in nature. Even
though there is a loss in the atomic behavior of the interface
removal operation, it was arguably incorrect to begin with.
The restoration of port DB records during a rollback after some
other failure doesn't undo the backend operations (e.g. REST calls)
that happened during the original deletion. So, having a delete
rollback without corresponding 'create_port' calls to the backend
causes a loss in consistency.

Conflicts:

	neutron/db/l3_db.py

Closes-Bug: #1377241
Change-Id: I5fdb6b24bf2fb80ac5e36a742aa7056db72c8c7d
(cherry picked from commit f23f2ecee68ba4abd12139bbb91b77ba9410f581)

subject: [4/5] Clean up Neutron resources upon tenant deletion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-21 12:38:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/66e659f9655c764e18e5f0b00d8daa594e8e3266', 'message': "[4/5] Clean up Neutron resources upon tenant deletion

Currently the different OpenStack components don't delete
resources when tenants are deleted. For large, long-running
deployments this might become a severe issue.

 1/5 - Create the identity service plugin.

 2/5 - Delete tenants by calling out to the core
       and service plugins, deleting all resources in the right
       order. Resources are deleted breadth first if multiple
       tenants are to be deleted. Instead of deleting
       tenant by tenant, delete all ports by all tenants, and
       so on for every type of resource.

 3/5 - Discover tenants that have resources in Neutron, that
       don't exist in Keystone.

*4/5 - Introduce a command line utility that executes code from
       patches 2 & 3. The utility calls out to the discovery
       functionality in the identity service plugin and persists
       the list of tenants to be deleted to disk. It can also
       pass that list to the delete function.

 5/5 - Respond to Keystone RPC notifications about tenant deletion.

DocImpact

commit_message:
[4/5] Clean up Neutron resources upon tenant deletion

Currently the different OpenStack components don't delete
resources when tenants are deleted. For large, long-running
deployments this might become a severe issue.

 1/5 - Create the identity service plugin.

 2/5 - Delete tenants by calling out to the core
       and service plugins, deleting all resources in the right
       order. Resources are deleted breadth first if multiple
       tenants are to be deleted. Instead of deleting
       tenant by tenant, delete all ports by all tenants, and
       so on for every type of resource.

 3/5 - Discover tenants that have resources in Neutron, that
       don't exist in Keystone.

*4/5 - Introduce a command line utility that executes code from
       patches 2 & 3. The utility calls out to the discovery
       functionality in the identity service plugin and persists
       the list of tenants to be deleted to disk. It can also
       pass that list to the delete function.

 5/5 - Respond to Keystone RPC notifications about tenant deletion.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #967832
Implements: blueprint tenant-delete

Change-Id: I294a868b6747acb723e50c1b5b2cd1266eda34eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/65/115965/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014, Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import datetime import os import sys from oslo.config import cfg from neutron.common import config from neutron.openstack.common import jsonutils from neutron.openstack.common import log as logging from neutron.services.identity import project_deleted from neutron.services.identity import sync LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('tenant_state_path', default='$state_path/tenant_delete', help=_('Location of tenant deletion records')), cfg.StrOpt('delete-by-file', dest='delete_by_file', help=_('Purge tenants stored via a previous --discover run')), cfg.BoolOpt('discover', default=False, help=_('Discover tenants that can be deleted and store' 'their IDs and resources to a file.')), cfg.BoolOpt('auto', default=False, help=_('Runs --discover and deletes those tenants.')), cfg.StrOpt('delete-by-id', dest='delete_by_id', help=_('Purge the given tenant')), ] def discover_leftovers(): return [tenant_id for tenant_id in list(sync.Sync().get_leftover_tenants()) if tenant_id != ''] def _get_timestamp(): return datetime.datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d-%H%M%S") def _ensure_conf_dir(): if not os.path.isdir(cfg.CONF.tenant_state_path): os.makedirs(cfg.CONF.tenant_state_path, 0o755) def write(tenants): _ensure_conf_dir() file_name = _get_timestamp() with open( os.path.join( cfg.CONF.tenant_state_path, file_name), 'w') as file_handle: jsonutils.dump(file_handle, tenants) def read(file_name): with open( os.path.join( cfg.CONF.tenant_state_path, file_name), 'r') as file_handle: tenant_ids = jsonutils.load(file_handle) return tenant_ids def delete(*tenants): project_deleted.ProjectDeleted(*tenants)() def _configure(): cfg.CONF.register_cli_opts(config.core_cli_opts) cfg.CONF.register_cli_opts(OPTS) cfg.CONF.set_override('use_stderr', True) config.setup_logging(cfg.CONF) config.init(sys.argv[1:]) def _usage(delete_by_file, discover, auto, delete_by_id): if not (auto ^ discover ^ bool(delete_by_file) ^ bool(delete_by_id)): LOG.error('auto, discover, delete_by_file and delete_by_id are ' 'mutually exclusive. Please choose one.') raise SystemExit(1) def main(): _configure() delete_by_file = cfg.CONF.delete_by_file discover = cfg.CONF.discover auto = cfg.CONF.auto delete_by_id = cfg.CONF.delete_by_id _usage(delete_by_file, discover, auto, delete_by_id) if discover or auto: left_overs = discover_leftovers() write(left_overs) if auto: delete(*left_overs) return if delete_by_file: left_overs = read(delete_by_file) print left_overs delete(*left_overs) return if delete_by_id: delete(delete_by_id) return

 5/5 - Respond to Keystone RPC notifications about tenant deletion.

commit_message:
[3/5] Clean up Neutron resources upon tenant deletion

Currently the different OpenStack components don't delete
resources when tenants are deleted. For large, long-running
deployments this might become a severe issue.

 1/5 - Create the identity service plugin.

 2/5 - Delete tenants by calling out to the core
       and service plugins, deleting all resources in the right
       order. Resources are deleted breadth first if multiple
       tenants are to be deleted. Instead of deleting
       tenant by tenant, delete all ports by all tenants, and
       so on for every type of resource.

*3/5 - Discover tenants that have resources in Neutron, that
       don't exist in Keystone.

 4/5 - Introduce a command line utility that executes code from
       patches 2 & 3. The utility calls out to the discovery
       functionality in the identity service plugin and persists
       the list of tenants to be deleted to disk. It can also
       pass that list to the delete function.

 5/5 - Respond to Keystone RPC notifications about tenant deletion.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #967832
Implements: blueprint tenant-delete

Change-Id: Ia76d500ea280fa9e158e21697caefc0f2d81d4bb

added_lines: # Copyright 2014, Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import contextlib import mock from neutron import context from neutron.services.identity import sync from neutron.tests.unit.db.firewall import test_db_firewall from neutron.tests.unit.db.loadbalancer import test_db_loadbalancer from neutron.tests.unit.db.metering import test_db_metering from neutron.tests.unit.db.vpn import test_db_vpnaas from neutron.tests.unit import test_api_v2 from neutron.tests.unit import test_extension_security_group from neutron.tests.unit import test_l3_plugin from neutron.tests.unit import test_quota_ext class TestIdentityQuota(test_quota_ext.QuotaExtensionTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestIdentityQuota, self).setUp() self.admin = context.get_admin_context() def _update_quota_limit(self, quota, tenant_id): env = {'neutron.context': context.Context('', tenant_id, is_admin=True)} quotas = {'quota': quota} self.api.put( test_api_v2._get_path('quotas', id=tenant_id, fmt=self.fmt), self.serialize(quotas), extra_environ=env, expect_errors=False) def test_get_local_tenants_quotas(self): for i in range(10): self._update_quota_limit({'network': 42}, str(i)) local_tenants = sync.Sync().get_local_tenants() self.assertEqual([str(i) for i in range(10)], sorted(list(local_tenants))) class TestIdentityFirewall(test_db_firewall.FirewallPluginDbTestCase): def test_get_local_tenants_firewalls(self): with contextlib.nested( self.firewall_rule(tenant_id='0'), self.firewall_policy(tenant_id='0'), self.firewall(tenant_id='0'), self.firewall_rule(tenant_id='1'), self.firewall_policy(tenant_id='1'), self.firewall_rule(tenant_id='2')): local_tenants = sync.Sync().get_local_tenants() self.assertEqual(['0', '1', '2'], sorted(list(local_tenants))) class TestIdentityVPN(test_db_vpnaas.VPNPluginDbTestCase): def test_get_local_tenants_vpns(self): with contextlib.nested( self.ikepolicy(), self.ipsecpolicy(), self.subnet(), self.router(tenant_id='test-tenant') ) as (ikepolicy, ipsecpolicy, subnet, router): with self.vpnservice( subnet=subnet, router=router ) as vpnservice: with self.ipsec_site_connection( vpnservice=vpnservice, ikepolicy=ikepolicy, ipsecpolicy=ipsecpolicy): local_tenants = sync.Sync().get_local_tenants() self.assertEqual(['', 'test-tenant'], sorted(list(local_tenants))) class TestIdentityMeter(test_db_metering.MeteringPluginDbTestCase): def test_get_local_tenants_meters(self): with contextlib.nested( self.metering_label(tenant_id='0'), self.metering_label(tenant_id='1')) as (label1, label2): with self.metering_label_rule(label1['metering_label']['id']): local_tenants = sync.Sync().get_local_tenants() self.assertEqual(['0', '1'], sorted(list(local_tenants))) class TestIdentityLoadBalancer( test_db_loadbalancer.LoadBalancerPluginDbTestCase): def test_get_local_tenants_load_balancers(self): with self.network() as network: with self.subnet(network=network) as subnet: with contextlib.nested( self.health_monitor(), self.pool()) as (monitor, pool): with self.vip(pool=pool, subnet=subnet): with self.member(pool_id=pool['pool']['id']): # TODO(amuller): Mock Sync.core_plugin.get_ports, # networks, subnets, so that it returns objects # with a different tenant_id. This way we know that # the LB resources' tenant_id was correctly picked # up. local_tenants = sync.Sync().get_local_tenants() self.assertEqual('test-tenant', local_tenants.pop()) class TestIdentityCore(test_l3_plugin.L3BaseForSepTests, test_l3_plugin.L3NatTestCaseMixin): def test_get_local_tenants_core(self): private_net = self._make_network(self.fmt, 'private', True) private_subnet = self._make_subnet(self.fmt, private_net, '10.0.0.1', '10.0.0.0/8') private_port = self._make_port(self.fmt, private_net['network']['id']) public_net = self._make_network(self.fmt, 'public', True, tenant_id='1') self._set_net_external(public_net['network']['id']) self._make_subnet(self.fmt, public_net, '200.0.0.1', '200.0.0.0/24') router = self._make_router(self.fmt, '0', external_gateway_info= {'network_id': public_net['network']['id']}) self._router_interface_action('add', router['router']['id'], private_subnet['subnet']['id'], None) self._make_floatingip(self.fmt, public_net['network']['id'], private_port['port']['id']) local_tenants = sync.Sync().get_local_tenants() # Ports owned by routers and floating IPs belong to the '' tenant self.assertEqual(['', '0', '1', 'test-tenant'], sorted(list(local_tenants))) class TestIdentitySecurityGroup( test_extension_security_group.SecurityGroupDBTestCase): def test_get_local_tenants_security_groups(self): self._make_security_group(self.fmt, '', '', tenant_id='0') self._make_security_group(self.fmt, '', '', tenant_id='1') self._make_security_group(self.fmt, '', '', tenant_id='2') local_tenants = sync.Sync().get_local_tenants() self.assertEqual(['0', '1', '2'], sorted(list(local_tenants))) class TestIdentitySync(test_l3_plugin.L3BaseForSepTests, test_l3_plugin.L3NatTestCaseMixin): def test_get_leftover_tenants(self): sync_object = sync.Sync() mock.patch('neutron.services.identity.sync.Sync.get_remote_tenants', return_value=set(['0'])).start() self._make_network(self.fmt, 'private', True, tenant_id='0') self._make_network(self.fmt, 'private', True, tenant_id='1') self._make_network(self.fmt, 'private', True, tenant_id='2') self.assertEqual(['1', '2'], sorted(list(sync_object.get_leftover_tenants())))

commit_message:
[2/5] Clean up Neutron resources upon tenant deletion

Currently the different OpenStack components don't delete
resources when tenants are deleted. For large, long-running
deployments this might become a severe issue.

 1/5 - Create the identity service plugin.

*2/5 - Delete tenants by calling out to the core
       and service plugins, deleting all resources in the right
       order. Resources are deleted breadth first if multiple
       tenants are to be deleted. Instead of deleting
       tenant by tenant, delete all ports by all tenants, and
       so on for every type of resource.

 3/5 - Discover tenants that have resources in Neutron, that
       don't exist in Keystone.

 4/5 - Introduce a command line utility that executes code from
       patches 2 & 3. The utility calls out to the discovery
       functionality in the identity service plugin and persists
       the list of tenants to be deleted to disk. It can also
       pass that list to the delete function.

 5/5 - Respond to Keystone RPC notifications about tenant deletion.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #967832
Implements: blueprint tenant-delete

Change-Id: I4b291f4e3d3285e42920d7e6fd0015c214038ee0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/00/92600/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # # Copyright 2014, Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # @author: Assaf Muller, amuller@redhat.com, Red Hat, Inc. import contextlib import webob from neutron import context from neutron.services.identity import project_deleted from neutron.tests.unit.db.firewall import test_db_firewall from neutron.tests.unit.db.loadbalancer import test_db_loadbalancer from neutron.tests.unit.db.metering import test_db_metering from neutron.tests.unit.db.vpn import test_db_vpnaas from neutron.tests.unit import test_api_v2 from neutron.tests.unit import test_extension_security_group from neutron.tests.unit import test_l3_plugin from neutron.tests.unit import test_quota_ext class TestIdentityQuota(test_quota_ext.QuotaExtensionTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestIdentityQuota, self).setUp() self.admin = context.get_admin_context() self._tenant_id = 'test-tenant' def _update_quota_limit(self, quota): env = {'neutron.context': context.Context('', self._tenant_id, is_admin=True)} quotas = {'quota': quota} self.api.put( test_api_v2._get_path('quotas', id=self._tenant_id, fmt=self.fmt), self.serialize(quotas), extra_environ=env, expect_errors=False) def _get_tenant_quotas(self): env = {'neutron.context': context.Context(self.admin, self._tenant_id, is_admin=True)} res = self.api.get( test_api_v2._get_path('quotas', fmt=self.fmt, id=self._tenant_id), extra_environ=env) return self.deserialize(res)['quota'] def test_delete_quotas(self): default_quota = self._get_tenant_quotas() self._update_quota_limit({'network': 42}) self.assertIn(('network', 42), list(self._get_tenant_quotas().iteritems())) project_deleted.ProjectDeleted(self._tenant_id).delete_quotas() self.assertEqual(default_quota, self._get_tenant_quotas()) class TestIdentityMixin(object): def _identity_show(self, resource, code, collection=None): type = resource.iterkeys().next() if collection is None: collection = '%ss' % type.replace('_', '-') self._show(collection, resource[type]['id'], expected_code=code) def _assert_found(self, resource, collection=None): self._identity_show(resource, webob.exc.HTTPOk.code, collection) def _assert_not_found(self, resource, collection=None): self._identity_show(resource, webob.exc.HTTPNotFound.code, collection) class TestIdentityFirewall(test_db_firewall.FirewallPluginDbTestCase, TestIdentityMixin): def test_delete_firewalls(self): with self.firewall_rule(no_delete=True) as rule: with self.firewall_policy( firewall_rules=[rule['firewall_rule']['id']], no_delete=True) as policy: with self.firewall( firewall_policy_id=policy['firewall_policy']['id'], no_delete=True) as fw: project_deleted.ProjectDeleted( self._tenant_id).delete_firewalls() self._assert_not_found(rule, 'firewall_rules') self._assert_not_found(policy, 'firewall_policies') self._assert_not_found(fw, 'firewalls') class TestIdentityVPN(test_db_vpnaas.VPNPluginDbTestCase, TestIdentityMixin): def test_delete_vpns(self): with contextlib.nested( self.ikepolicy(no_delete=True), self.ipsecpolicy(no_delete=True), self.subnet(), self.router()) as (ikepolicy, ipsecpolicy, subnet, router): with self.vpnservice(subnet=subnet, router=router, no_delete=True)\ as vpnservice: with self.ipsec_site_connection( vpnservice=vpnservice, ikepolicy=ikepolicy, ipsecpolicy=ipsecpolicy, no_delete=True): project_deleted.ProjectDeleted( self._tenant_id).delete_vpns() self._assert_not_found(ikepolicy, 'ikepolicies') self._assert_not_found(ipsecpolicy, 'ipsecpolicies') self._assert_not_found(vpnservice, 'vpnservices') # Doing a show on an ipsec connection post deletion gives a 500 error self.assertEqual(len( self._list('ipsec-site-connections')['ipsec_site_connections']), 0) class TestIdentityMeter(test_db_metering.MeteringTestPlugin, TestIdentityMixin): def test_delete_meters(self): with self.metering_label(no_delete=True) as label: with self.metering_label_rule(label['metering_label']['id'], no_delete=True) as rule: project_deleted.ProjectDeleted(self._tenant_id).delete_meters() for resource in (label, rule): self._assert_not_found(resource) class TestIdentityLoadBalancer( test_db_loadbalancer.LoadBalancerPluginDbTestCase, TestIdentityMixin): def _attach_monitor_to_pool(self, monitor, pool): data = { 'health_monitor': { 'id': monitor['health_monitor']['id'], 'tenant_id': self._tenant_id } } req = self.new_create_request( 'pools', data, fmt=self.fmt, id=pool['pool']['id'], subresource='health_monitors') req.get_response(self.ext_api) def test_delete_load_balancers(self): with self.subnet() as subnet: with self.health_monitor(no_delete=True) as monitor: with self.pool(name="pool1", no_delete=True) as pool: self._attach_monitor_to_pool(monitor, pool) with self.vip(pool=pool, subnet=subnet, no_delete=True) \ as vip: with self.member(pool_id=pool['pool']['id'], no_delete=True) as member: project_deleted.ProjectDeleted( self._tenant_id).delete_load_balancers() for resource in (pool, vip, member): self._assert_not_found(resource) self._assert_not_found(monitor, collection='health_monitors') class TestIdentityCore(test_l3_plugin.L3BaseForSepTests, test_l3_plugin.L3NatTestCaseMixin, TestIdentityMixin): def test_delete_shared_network(self): network = self._make_network(self.fmt, "private", True, shared=True) port1 = self._make_port(self.fmt, network['network']['id']) port2 = self._make_port(self.fmt, network['network']['id'], tenant_id='other_tenant') project_deleted.ProjectDeleted('other_tenant')() self._assert_not_found(port2) self._assert_found(port1) self._assert_found(network) project_deleted.ProjectDeleted(self._tenant_id)() self._assert_not_found(port1) self._assert_not_found(network) def test_delete_ports_networks_subnets_routers_floatingips(self): private_net = self._make_network(self.fmt, "private", True) private_subnet = self._make_subnet(self.fmt, private_net, "10.0.0.1", "10.0.0.0/8") private_port = self._make_port(self.fmt, private_net['network']['id']) public_net = self._make_network(self.fmt, 'public', True) self._set_net_external(public_net['network']['id']) public_subnet = self._make_subnet(self.fmt, public_net, "200.0.0.1", "200.0.0.0/24") router = self._make_router(self.fmt, self._tenant_id, "router1", True, {'network_id': public_net['network']['id']}) self._router_interface_action('add', router['router']['id'], private_subnet['subnet']['id'], None) floating_ip = self._make_floatingip(self.fmt, public_net['network']['id'], private_port['port']['id']) project_deleted.ProjectDeleted(self._tenant_id)() for resource in (private_net, private_subnet, private_port, public_net, public_subnet, router, floating_ip): self._assert_not_found(resource) class TestIdentitySecurityGroup( test_extension_security_group.SecurityGroupDBTestCase, TestIdentityMixin): def test_delete_security_groups(self): with self.network(no_delete=True) as network: with self.subnet(network, no_delete=True) as subnet: with self.security_group(no_delete=True) as sg1: with self.security_group(no_delete=True) as sg2: with self.security_group_rule( security_group_id=sg1['security_group']['id'], no_delete=True) as rule: res = self._create_port( self.fmt, network['network']['id'], security_groups=[sg1['security_group']['id'], sg2['security_group']['id']]) port = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) project_deleted.ProjectDeleted(self._tenant_id)() for resource in (network, subnet, sg1, sg2, rule, port): self._assert_not_found(resource)

Adds device existence check in MetaInterfaceDriver.plug()

Adds device existance check in plug() function of MetaInterfaceDriver.
Related-Bug:1348703
