added_lines: if not ip_lib.device_exists(device_name, self.root_helper, namespace=namespace): driver = self._get_driver_by_network_id(network_id) ret = driver.plug(network_id, port_id, device_name, mac_address, bridge=bridge, namespace=namespace, prefix=prefix) self._set_device_plugin_tag(network_id, device_name, namespace) return ret
deleted_lines: driver = self._get_driver_by_network_id(network_id) ret = driver.plug(network_id, port_id, device_name, mac_address, bridge=bridge, namespace=namespace, prefix=prefix) self._set_device_plugin_tag(network_id, device_name, namespace) return ret

subject: Clean up iSCSI multipath devices in Post Live Migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-13 05:38:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9c3ec16576e2f7c9d5aff6e4b620d708e6636568', 'message': "Clean up iSCSI multipath devices in Post Live Migration

When a volume is attached to a VM in the source compute node through
multipath, the related files in /dev/disk/by-path/ are like this

stack@ubuntu-server12:~/devstack$ ls /dev/disk/by-path/*24
/dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.168.3.50:3260-iscsi-iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.
fnm00124500890.a5-lun-24
/dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.168.4.51:3260-iscsi-iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.
fnm00124500890.b4-lun-24

The information on its corresponding multipath device is like this
stack@ubuntu-server12:~/devstack$ sudo multipath -l 3600601602ba034
00921130967724e411
3600601602ba03400921130967724e411 dm-3 DGC,VRAID
size=1.0G features='1 queue_if_no_path' hwhandler='1 alua' wp=rw
|-+- policy='round-robin 0' prio=-1 status=active
| `- 19:0:0:24 sdl 8:176 active undef running
`-+- policy='round-robin 0' prio=-1 status=enabled
  `- 18:0:0:24 sdj 8:144 active undef running

But when the VM is migrated to the destination, the related information is
like the following example since we CANNOT guarantee that all nodes are able
to access the same iSCSI portals and the same target LUN number. And the
information is used to overwrite connection_info in the DB before the post
live migration logic is executed.

stack@ubuntu-server13:~/devstack$ ls /dev/disk/by-path/*24
/dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.168.3.51:3260-iscsi-iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.
fnm00124500890.b5-lun-100
/dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.168.4.51:3260-iscsi-iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.
fnm00124500890.b4-lun-100

stack@ubuntu-server13:~/devstack$ sudo multipath -l 3600601602ba034
00921130967724e411
3600601602ba03400921130967724e411 dm-3 DGC,VRAID
size=1.0G features='1 queue_if_no_path' hwhandler='1 alua' wp=rw
|-+- policy='round-robin 0' prio=-1 status=active
| `- 19:0:0:100 sdf 8:176 active undef running
`-+- policy='round-robin 0' prio=-1 status=enabled
  `- 18:0:0:100 sdg 8:144 active undef running

As a result, if post live migration in source side uses <IP>, <IQN> and
<TARGET LUN Number> to find the devices to clean up, it may use 192.168.3.51,
iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.fnm00124500890.a5 and 100.
However, the correct one should be 192.168.3.50, iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.
fnm00124500890.a5 and 24.

Similar philosophy in (https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1327497) can be
used to fix it: Leverage the unchanged multipath_id to find correct devices
to delete.

Change-Id: I875293c3ade9423caa2b8afe9eca25a74606d262
Closes-Bug: #1357368
(cherry picked from commit aa9104ccedb3ff13cc34a498b11f5e8ff100fd99)
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up iSCSI multipath devices in Post Live Migration

When a volume is attached to a VM in the source compute node through
multipath, the related files in /dev/disk/by-path/ are like this

stack@ubuntu-server12:~/devstack$ ls /dev/disk/by-path/*24
/dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.168.3.50:3260-iscsi-iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.
fnm00124500890.a5-lun-24
/dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.168.4.51:3260-iscsi-iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.
fnm00124500890.b4-lun-24

The information on its corresponding multipath device is like this
stack@ubuntu-server12:~/devstack$ sudo multipath -l 3600601602ba034
00921130967724e411
3600601602ba03400921130967724e411 dm-3 DGC,VRAID
size=1.0G features='1 queue_if_no_path' hwhandler='1 alua' wp=rw
|-+- policy='round-robin 0' prio=-1 status=active
| `- 19:0:0:24 sdl 8:176 active undef running
`-+- policy='round-robin 0' prio=-1 status=enabled
  `- 18:0:0:24 sdj 8:144 active undef running

But when the VM is migrated to the destination, the related information is
like the following example since we CANNOT guarantee that all nodes are able
to access the same iSCSI portals and the same target LUN number. And the
information is used to overwrite connection_info in the DB before the post
live migration logic is executed.

stack@ubuntu-server13:~/devstack$ ls /dev/disk/by-path/*24
/dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.168.3.51:3260-iscsi-iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.
fnm00124500890.b5-lun-100
/dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.168.4.51:3260-iscsi-iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.
fnm00124500890.b4-lun-100

stack@ubuntu-server13:~/devstack$ sudo multipath -l 3600601602ba034
00921130967724e411
3600601602ba03400921130967724e411 dm-3 DGC,VRAID
size=1.0G features='1 queue_if_no_path' hwhandler='1 alua' wp=rw
|-+- policy='round-robin 0' prio=-1 status=active
| `- 19:0:0:100 sdf 8:176 active undef running
`-+- policy='round-robin 0' prio=-1 status=enabled
  `- 18:0:0:100 sdg 8:144 active undef running

As a result, if post live migration in source side uses <IP>, <IQN> and
<TARGET LUN Number> to find the devices to clean up, it may use 192.168.3.51,
iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.fnm00124500890.a5 and 100.
However, the correct one should be 192.168.3.50, iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.
fnm00124500890.a5 and 24.

Similar philosophy in (https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1327497) can be
used to fix it: Leverage the unchanged multipath_id to find correct devices
to delete.

Change-Id: I875293c3ade9423caa2b8afe9eca25a74606d262
Closes-Bug: #1357368
(cherry picked from commit aa9104ccedb3ff13cc34a498b11f5e8ff100fd99)

added_lines: def test_libvirt_iscsi_driver_multipath_id(self): libvirt_driver = volume.LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver(self.fake_conn) libvirt_driver.use_multipath = True self.stubs.Set(libvirt_driver, '_run_iscsiadm_bare', lambda x, check_exit_code: ('',)) self.stubs.Set(libvirt_driver, '_rescan_iscsi', lambda: None) self.stubs.Set(libvirt_driver, '_get_host_device', lambda x: None) self.stubs.Set(libvirt_driver, '_rescan_multipath', lambda: None) fake_multipath_id = 'fake_multipath_id' fake_multipath_device = '/dev/mapper/%s' % fake_multipath_id self.stubs.Set(libvirt_driver, '_get_multipath_device_name', lambda x: fake_multipath_device) def fake_disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi(iscsi_properties, multipath_device): if fake_multipath_device != multipath_device: raise Exception('Invalid multipath_device.') self.stubs.Set(libvirt_driver, '_disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi', fake_disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi) with mock.patch.object(os.path, 'exists', return_value=True): vol = {'id': 1, 'name': self.name} connection_info = self.iscsi_connection(vol, self.location, self.iqn) libvirt_driver.connect_volume(connection_info, self.disk_info) self.assertEqual(fake_multipath_id, connection_info['data']['multipath_id']) libvirt_driver.disconnect_volume(connection_info, "fake")

commit_message:
Fix missing root_helper argument in IpNetnsCommand

Without root privileges command 'ip netns list' returns empty list
of network namespaces, even if are present.

Change-Id: I7cc9737c1375645c93a082aeb179af876486d8e9
Closes-Bug: #1311804

deleted_lines: output = self._parent._execute('o', 'netns', ['list'])

commit_message:
Generate javelin config dynamically

The current javelin config makes assumptions about what services
devstack has actually deployed and will fail if those assumptions
are not correct. We're now testing more than just the default devstack
topology. The list of resources grenade expects javelin to act on needs to
be flexible if we want it to support these non-standard configs. This adds
a tool to dynamically generate the javelin resources yaml depending on
what services devstack has deployed, using the existing resources.yaml
has a base.

Change-Id: Iaf9381e185d4875e6098fe5f3573b5bb61c01e33

commit_message:
Initial functional test case for IptablesManager

This is the initial functional test case for IptablesManager.
This test case applies the default iptables rules/chains to
a dummy namespace.

Related-Bug: 1243216
Change-Id: I03d22ed5182601671eea5f9104de126f57c8f5f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/49/102749/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Intel Corporation. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from neutron.agent.linux.ip_lib import IPWrapper from neutron.agent.linux.iptables_manager import IptablesManager from neutron.tests.functional.agent.linux import base class TestIptablesManager(base.BaseLinuxTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestIptablesManager, self).setUp() self._namespace = self.get_rand_name(max_length=16) self.ipwrapper = IPWrapper(root_helper=self.root_helper) self.ipwrapper.ensure_namespace(self._namespace) self.addCleanup(self._cleanup_namespace) def test_iptables_manager(self): """Test iptables default chains This function test the default chains created by IptablesManager by applying the rules/chains to a dummy namespace. It will fail if the operation fails. """ mgr = IptablesManager(root_helper=self.root_helper, namespace=self._namespace, binary_name=__name__) mgr.apply() def _cleanup_namespace(self): netns = self.ipwrapper.netns if netns.exists(self._namespace): netns.delete(self._namespace)

commit_message:
Removes duplicate checks for device existance

Classes derived from LinuxInterfaceDriver already check for
the device existence in the method plug().
The code calling driver.plug() shouldn't check for the device existence,
it's a duplicate and it's an expensive call.

Closes-Bug:1348703

Change-Id: I3bdddd90dd7bd28c6024b9ac7694db682e4e4afa

commit_message:
Improve testing of project federation tokens for inherited roles.

Currently project-scoped federation-generated tokens fail to include
group roles that are inherited to the project from the owning domain.
This error is also exposed via the /auth/projects and
/OS-FEDERATION/projects API calls.

This patch enhances our testing to demonstrate the error - a follow-on
patch will fix it.

Partially implements: bug 1389752

Change-Id: I359de7f0e331e7bb5786ab892885b57954b8e442

commit_message:
bump pecan minimum version number to 0.8.0

Several bugs have been fixed in more recent releases of pecan[1].  The
JSON handling in 0.8.0 will make it easier to transition to pecan.

[1] http://pecan.readthedocs.org/en/latest/changes.html

Change-Id: I773b52e2a0dcbf7e17dc9653b069ff0ee989e040

commit_message:
Make l3-agent be able to load advanced service drivers

Also converts FWaaS code using the new driver scheme as an example.

Change-Id: I371f2ab8830f0481c3eb1be7f730146138b613f7
Implements: blueprint l3-agent-consolidation

commit_message:
Skip some tests when cinder is not enabled

test_delete_server_while_in_attached_volume:
    Skip when cinder is not enabled.
ServerRescueTestJSON:
    No test access the volume resource_setup creates, so stop creating one.
ServerRescueNegativeTestJSON:
    Move volume creation into tests that use it and skip them when cinder
    is not enabled.

Change-Id: I8587c3e5ff3dbf5f23d09a5fd49b2c55c2ef7657
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/65/130665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.

This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

Change-Id: I1dd9fed18051cac2d5d14b60eb94a03a4d35909a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/59/132359/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: builtins = _

commit_message:
Beef up object-store tests

* Add object top-to-bottom tests
* Move some fakes around
* Clean up existing object tests

Change-Id: If8406da611c11bbd2b1bf5153e45b720b0eea442

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import copy from requests_mock.contrib import fixture from openstackclient.object.v1 import object as object_cmds from openstackclient.tests.object.v1 import fakes as object_fakes class TestObjectAll(object_fakes.TestObjectv1): def setUp(self): super(TestObjectAll, self).setUp() self.requests_mock = self.useFixture(fixture.Fixture()) class TestObjectCreate(TestObjectAll): def setUp(self): super(TestObjectCreate, self).setUp() # Get the command object to test self.cmd = object_cmds.CreateObject(self.app, None) class TestObjectList(TestObjectAll): def setUp(self): super(TestObjectList, self).setUp() # Get the command object to test self.cmd = object_cmds.ListObject(self.app, None) def test_object_list_objects_no_options(self): return_body = [ copy.deepcopy(object_fakes.OBJECT), copy.deepcopy(object_fakes.OBJECT_2), ] self.requests_mock.register_uri( 'GET', object_fakes.ENDPOINT + '/' + object_fakes.container_name + '?format=json', json=return_body, status_code=200, ) arglist = [ object_fakes.container_name, ] verifylist = [ ('container', object_fakes.container_name), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # Lister.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) collist = ('Name',) self.assertEqual(collist, columns) datalist = [ (object_fakes.object_name_1, ), (object_fakes.object_name_2, ), ] self.assertEqual(datalist, list(data)) def test_object_list_objects_prefix(self): return_body = [ copy.deepcopy(object_fakes.OBJECT_2), ] self.requests_mock.register_uri( 'GET', object_fakes.ENDPOINT + '/' + object_fakes.container_name_2 + '?prefix=floppy&format=json', json=return_body, status_code=200, ) arglist = [ '--prefix', 'floppy', object_fakes.container_name_2, ] verifylist = [ ('prefix', 'floppy'), ('container', object_fakes.container_name_2), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) collist = ('Name',) self.assertEqual(columns, collist) datalist = ( (object_fakes.object_name_2, ), ) self.assertEqual(tuple(data), datalist) class TestObjectShow(TestObjectAll): def setUp(self): super(TestObjectShow, self).setUp() # Get the command object to test self.cmd = object_cmds.ShowObject(self.app, None) def test_object_show(self): headers = { 'content-type': 'text/plain', 'content-length': '20', 'last-modified': 'yesterday', 'etag': '4c4e39a763d58392724bccf76a58783a', 'x-container-meta-owner': object_fakes.ACCOUNT_ID, 'x-object-manifest': 'manifest', } self.requests_mock.register_uri( 'HEAD', '/'.join([ object_fakes.ENDPOINT, object_fakes.container_name, object_fakes.object_name_1, ]), headers=headers, status_code=200, ) arglist = [ object_fakes.container_name, object_fakes.object_name_1, ] verifylist = [ ('container', object_fakes.container_name), ('object', object_fakes.object_name_1), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) collist = ( 'account', 'container', 'content-length', 'content-type', 'etag', 'last-modified', 'object', 'x-object-manifest', ) self.assertEqual(collist, columns) datalist = ( object_fakes.ACCOUNT_ID, object_fakes.container_name, '20', 'text/plain', '4c4e39a763d58392724bccf76a58783a', 'yesterday', object_fakes.object_name_1, 'manifest', ) self.assertEqual(datalist, data)

commit_message:
WIP - Service Insertion - changes required for VPNaaS

Implements the VPN specific changes required for the service base
and insertion spec @ I595d7fe224f49f8cbc4203569d7862deaa74e1e7
which has been approved for Juno.

Note that this is early WIP, in particular it needs to be rebased on
the definition of ServiceBase and the ServiceInterface db models
(the latter is carried here for now) when this becomes available.

TODO_LIST:
1. DB Migrations
2. Tests

Change-Id: I0843b97b4fae40b87c1820e54c6d79c201d38b0b

commit_message:
Add ovs validation during agent boot up

There is no check during agent boot up, and setup operations
cause agent crash, as bug #1351135 confirmed. Add validation
check upon ovs, to prevent the crash.

Closes-bug: #1351135
Change-Id: Ifd0174b8324c3267ae6df971d51bfdc51523441d

commit_message:
Remove VM management calls

Per the discussion in the 12-Nov-2014 openstack octavia meeting, remove
the definition of start(), stop(), suspend(), resume(), and backup().

Change-Id: Iefc9c295ec5188b871681ff1804b563ac4feff32

By the way, is someone know this method need for? Method's docsting tell

on the same subnet." But this have no sense.

commit_message:
Remove potential extra work in IpRouteCommand

Variable device_list initialisation and usage is messed up in method
IpRouteCommand.pullup_route. This lead to multiple remove/add same
routes on interface. It's not affect final result, but it does extra
work.

By the way, is someone know this method need for? Method's docsting tell
us "Ensures that the route entry for the interface is before all others
on the same subnet." But this have no sense.

Records in routing table sorted according to destination netmask.  More
specific rules goes first. more common goes last. If someone really need
to change order of records in routing table he should use separate
routing table (See "man ip-route" for info about routing tables and
routing rules. Don't mess routing rules and routing records.)

Change-Id: I0b4d937cbb30fe0f8e6a5f130943965447a551ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/25/115725/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(dbogun): when this can happen? records in routing table sorted according to destination netmask length. If someone need change order of records in routing table he should use separate routing table (See man ip-route for info about routing tables and routing rules. Don't mess up with routing rules and routing records.) device_list = []
deleted_lines: device_list = []

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE - detect stale host_id in get_device_details RPC

Test code added to detect intermittent stale host_id in ML2
port_binding record from query during get_device_details RPC.

In my tests, the following test case fails about 35% of the time:

neutron.tests.unit.ml2.drivers.test_l2population.TestL2PopulationRpcTestCase.test_host_changed_twice

Change-Id: I5d48996362085d42bbfa81a25a9a1dd440f6cd45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/39/116039/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if host and port_db.port_binding.host != host: # DO NOT MERGE LOG.error(_("Mismatched hosts - host: %s, binding: %s") % (host, port_db.port_binding)) return

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-26 12:33:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d17fe3cb2c347f8d6ead4ef96b9987d86d318acc', 'message': "Fix deletion of vlan interfaces

Change-Id: I182a1142b65435bb509c62f1c17db683ae5a7457

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-27 11:36:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2d16c2c20bc3a944b23a77cba3691f410baaf8e7', 'message': "Fix deletion of vlan interfaces

Refactor the deletion of the bridge by making it explicit that we
deal with two types of interfaces that can be attached to a bridge, a tap
and no tap interface, tap interfaces are always to be deleted and no tap
interfaces, that can be a vlan or flat interface, should only be delete if
they were created by the agent. Make also sure that linuxbridge agent
doesn't delete no tap interfaces if they are specified in the
physical_interface_mappings.

Change-Id: I182a1142b65435bb509c62f1c17db683ae5a7457
Closes-Bug: #1334634
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-04 14:29:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/cf336bf307d592799b14d158a013d3a78ff40f64', 'message': "lb-agent: refactor and fix deletion bridge

- Change delete_bridge function name to reflect that it doesn't only
  work with vlans but also for example with vxlan.
- Don't assume anymore that the bridge doesn't have any tap when the
  delete_bridge is called, even though normally that's the case because
  tap devices are ususally handled by either l3, dhcp agent or
  nova-compute service.
- Make also sure that linuxbridge agent doesn't delete vlan interfaces
  if they are specified in the physical_interface_mappings, fixing bug

commit_message:
lb-agent: refactor and fix bridge deletion

- Change delete_bridge function name to reflect that it doesn't only
  work with vlans but also for example with vxlan, same with
  delete_interface function.
- Make sure that linuxbridge agent doesn't delete vlan interfaces
  if they are specified in the physical_interface_mappings, fixing bug
  #1334634.

Change-Id: I182a1142b65435bb509c62f1c17db683ae5a7457
Closes-Bug: #1334634

commit_message:
ovs agent: port may lose vlan tag

When a port is added and then removed in short time, it may lose its
vlan tag permanently util be removed and added again.

Change-Id: Id3a3dc857dffb729b2bc3bfc96c30d313a690037
Closes-bug: 1328128

subject: Ensure host_routes order in subnet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-07 12:18:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/900b05b307bc50cc060f8a4fbbe5e5e20e6b6d0d', 'message': 'Ensure host_routes order in subnet

As route may recursive, some routes must be installed after the
depending route. So we need a mechanism to set the order of host_routes
in subnet manually.

This patch add an order column to host_routes table, which describe the
order of routes, routes are applied from lower order to higher.

There is a change to subnet API, but it is backward competible.

Change-Id: I3d883db64cce1f145ceb997f2e42582475ebc86f

commit_message:
Ensure host_routes order in subnet

As route may be recursive, some routes must be installed after the
depending route. So we need a mechanism to set the order of host_routes
in subnet manually.

This patch add an order column to host_routes table, which describe the
order of routes, routes are applied from lower order to higher.

Gerrit Spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/94563/
Implements: blueprint neutron-route-order
Change-Id: I3d883db64cce1f145ceb997f2e42582475ebc86f
Closes-Bug: #1288606

added_lines: order = sa.Column(sa.Integer, nullable=False, default=10, primary_key=False)

commit_message:
Fixed service stop call

MessagingServer doesn't have a `kill` method. `stop` method should be used
instead.

Change-Id: I8c33791a8997690f50a87d698e864a167ba04ed1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/57/111057/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: server.stop()
deleted_lines: server.kill()

commit_message:
Update router status of l3agent

Router status of l3agent has only ACTIVE.
But router should have other status such as PENDING_UPDATE and ERROR.

When ERROR occurs in l3agent process, neutron set "ERROR" to router status of DB.
This code is modified for l3agent(non DVR).

Change-Id: I44f03ea66d8e5ddb974963ecfa994b6af75c72c8
Closes-Bug: 1341290
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/70/112770/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_process_router_update(self): agent = l3_agent.L3NATAgent(HOSTNAME, self.conf) with mock.patch.object( agent.plugin_rpc, 'update_router_status') as mock_update_router_status: router = prepare_router_data() agent._queue = mock.Mock() update = mock.Mock() update.id = router['id'] update.router = router agent._queue.each_update_to_next_router.return_value = [(mock.Mock(), update)] agent._process_routers = mock.Mock() agent._process_router_update() # Assess the call for putting the router up was performed mock_update_router_status.assert_any_call( mock.ANY, router['id'], status=l3_constants.L3_STATUS_PENDING_UPDATE) mock_update_router_status.assert_called_with( mock.ANY, router['id'], status=l3_constants.L3_STATUS_ACTIVE) # Test error handling agent._process_routers.side_effect = Exception self.assertRaises(Exception, agent._process_router_update) # Assess the call for putting the router up was performed mock_update_router_status.assert_called_with( mock.ANY, router['id'], status=l3_constants.L3_STATUS_ERROR)

commit_message:
WIP:  Don't run ra_dvd inside of snat namespaces

This is a placeholder patch for now.  I need to work out where ra_dvd
should be run.  My initial feeling is that it should only be run in
qrouter namespaces and not snat namespaces.

BTW, a unit test failure in Jenkins is expected as long as this is a
WIP.

Change-Id: I8686bd7e672f986f6249f483e841825ecff15db6
Closes-bug: #WIP

deleted_lines: # Expect process manager to disable one radvd per stale namespace expected_pm_disables = len(stale_namespace_list) # Expect process manager to disable metadata proxy per qrouter ns expected_pm_disables += len(qrouters)

subject: Fix support of external gw-ip outside subnet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-14 10:04:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f70e4a2c768efd565a1b6b79f5c097f975982257', 'message': 'Fix support of external gw-ip outside subnet

Before fix when l3-agent was trying to create a route with the
gateway IP which is outside the external network subnet, the
command was failing since the router namespace does not know anything
about the gateway IP/cidr.

After fix, a static route of gateway-ip is created before adding the
default route. Because of which now the gw-ip is known to router
namespace. Respective unit test cases also fixed.

Change-Id: Ie00c579710a81b19c2a27fc558b70a415ba16ae9
Closes-Bug: #1335023
'}]
commit_message:
Fix support of external gw-ip outside subnet

Before fix when l3-agent was trying to create a route with the
gateway IP which is outside the external network subnet, the
command was failing since the router namespace does not know anything
about the gateway IP/cidr.

After fix, a static route of gateway-ip is created before adding the
default route. Because of which now the gw-ip is known to router
namespace. Respective unit test cases also fixed.

Change-Id: Ie00c579710a81b19c2a27fc558b70a415ba16ae9
Closes-Bug: #1335023

OVS crash/restart is unpredictable, so neutron-ovs-agent should be
robust enough under that situation. But currently ovs-agent doesn't

to treat ovs dead/restart graceful, to prevent agent crash while it
is running. And handle ovs-dead error during ovs-agent boot up.

Change-Id: Ia8ecfbe5f95f6eed32e1b58bd7742f0b539fc506

commit_message:
OVS-Agent crashes when OVS dead(Alternative I)

Alternative patch of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/113450/
(Just for reference, and this line will be removed before merge.)
OVS crash/restart is unpredictable, so neutron-ovs-agent should be
robust enough under that situation. But currently ovs-agent doesn't
figure out this error status(only check ovs restarted status) and
still continue to apply subsequent opreations(set br/add patch
port/...) till causing exceptions/crash. Add proper fail-over code
to treat ovs dead/restart graceful, to prevent agent crash while it
is running. And handle ovs-dead error during ovs-agent boot up.

Closes-bug: #1296202
Change-Id: Ia8ecfbe5f95f6eed32e1b58bd7742f0b539fc506

commit_message:
db migration failed when plugin name alias used in config file

due to blueprint config-plugin-by-name[1], convenient plugin name alias
can be use in config file, but the db migration doesn't understand the
name alias. If the alias is used, when db migration try to get the name
of enabled core/service plugins, it will get the alias instead of full
the class name. The patch helps the db migration to resolve the alias
to the full class name.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/config-plugin-by-name

Closes-Bug: #1286052
Change-Id: Idf13417c85bfafa666ca1d9fb5e94a5164d74abd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/21/81221/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from stevedore import driver def _get_plugin_class_name(namespace, plugin_provider): try: # Try to resolve plugin by name mgr = driver.DriverManager(namespace, plugin_provider) plugin_class = mgr.driver except RuntimeError: # fallback to class name try: plugin_class = importutils.import_class(plugin_provider) except ImportError: raise ImportError(_("Plugin not found.")) return "%s.%s" % (plugin_class.__module__, plugin_class.__name__) active_plugins = [ _get_plugin_class_name('neutron.core_plugins', neutron_config.core_plugin) ] active_plugins += [ _get_plugin_class_name('neutron.service_plugins', plugin) for plugin in neutron_config.service_plugins ]
deleted_lines: plugin_class_path = neutron_config.core_plugin active_plugins = [plugin_class_path] active_plugins += neutron_config.service_plugins for class_path in active_plugins: importutils.import_class(class_path)

commit_message:
Autocreated ports count against port quota

This commit adds a filter when counting port quota to avoid counting
auto-created ports used by neutron routers, dhcp servers and floating ip
addresses.

Closes-bug: #1212338

Change-Id: Idb8a498a647fa7e4cbaf4b28804f99f5580d9dce

commit_message:
Added parsing format for ethernet alias names

Network-to-interface mapping format uses ':' to separate network from
interface. This syntax does not allow use of ethernet alias names.
Adding additional '|' separator which takes precedence over ':'.

Change-Id: I3d8f709d30d2bf7fc8b6375265972c9905889c5e
Closes-Bug: #1288641

commit_message:
Modular L2 Agent code fragments

Please note these code fragments are just for reviewing
possible approaches for building modular L2 agents. The
code submitted here is NOT functional. It is NOT a Poc
either. These code fragments are being put here for sharing
ideas and discussion in the ML2 subgroup.

Please review and comment in that spirit. All suggestions
for bettring this approach and/or for putting forward new
approaches are most welcome.

More info can be found in the following evolving etherpad:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/modular-l2-agent-outline

Change-Id: I71ab95709557df8ec477177ef8d88df71f93262d

commit_message:
ML2: Prevent lock wait timeout in update_port

The update_port routine performs a SELECT...FOR UPDATE query
on ports. However, if the same port is being deleted
concurrently, it might end up trying to acquire a lock which
will never be released if the thread performing delete_port
yielded from within the transaction.

This has been observed in upstream gating jobs, especially
in connection with update_port operations executed by the
load balancing service plugin.

This patch changes update_port by acquiring a semaphore
for database access before starting the transaction.
In order to avoid unnecessary global locks for db resources,
this patch changes lock name generation in way that
the lock applies only to the resource being update.
The lock name change is applied also to the other places
where the DB access lock is acquired.

Closes-Bug: 1313794

Change-Id: I9013942220dfd72358ca464459581ef0ad95e7c1

commit_message:
Add requirement for APIImpact flag

Adds a requirement for an APIImpact flag in
the commit message for a proposed spec if it proposes
changes to the Glance REST API. This will make it
much easier for people such as the API WG who want to
review API changes across OpenStack to find and
review proposed API changes.

Change-Id: Ic83a797b3feae28052abba78ac9abc4a07f4063e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/22/131622/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * If your specification proposes any changes to the Glance REST API such as changing parameters which can be returned or accepted, or even the semantics of what happens when a client calls into the API, then you should add the APIImpact flag to the commit message. Specifications with the APIImpact flag can be found with the following query:: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/nova-specs+message:apiimpact,n,z

commit_message:
Add read only API for default quotas

This patch add api function to get default quotas when request is like:
GET /v2.0/quotas/default ("default" is a special tenant-id to represent the
default quotas.)
It is variant (1) from comment
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1204956/comments/1 in bug report

Change-Id: I26aa500d5dec632a9afd940402f1c0278ff981e0
Closes-Bug: 1204956

commit_message:
Ensure .egg-info metadata directory existed

Without .egg-info metadata directory, testcase which invokes entry points to
load plugins will fail.
This patch add "python setup.py egg_info" in run_test.sh to fix this.

Change-Id: I6eff4a8805e554f9a58e5395f0c6b607d7d2cbf8
Closes-Bug: 1204456

OVS methods for SSL configs, resetting the switch config and show db contents.

added_lines: def reset_configuration(self): """Perform an emergency reset and bring back to known good state""" self.run_vsctl(['emer-reset', ], check_error=True) def show(self): """Output contents in db""" self.run_vsctl(['emer-reset', ], check_error=True) def get_ssl_config(self): """Return SSL configuration""" return self.run_vsctl(['get-ssl'], check_error=True) def delete_ssl_config(self): """Remove SSL configuration""" self.run_vsctl(['del-ssl'], check_error=True)

commit_message:
L3_agent router can't update external_gateway_info

We can change router external_gateway_info(external_network)
by RestAPI, but l3_agent can't update router external_network.

Change-Id: I8a50de745fe844c00bfcc78cfbdd654c226eedf5
closes-bug: #1320728

commit_message:
L2 pop removes unuseful regular mac learning rules

This patch removes the regular mac learning rules
when the l2 population mechanism driver is used.

Without the regular mac learning there is no more use of
the table 10 and the unknown unicasts will be droppped.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Ovs-flow-logic

Closes-bug: #1297782
Change-Id: I1a47d493e00159d49c157a940927ab53edb799a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/53/83053/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.l2_pop_regular_mac_learning = ( cfg.CONF.AGENT.l2_population_regular_mac_learning) # with the l2 population we can skip the mac learning # since the l2 population handles it through the # fdb_add/fdb_remove/fdb_update methods if not self.l2_pop_regular_mac_learning: self.tun_br.add_flow(table=constants.TUN_TABLE[network_type], priority=1, tun_id=segmentation_id, actions="mod_vlan_vid:%s,output:%s" % (lvid, self.patch_int_ofport)) else: # inbound from tunnels: set lvid in the right table # and resubmit to Table LEARN_FROM_TUN for mac learning self.tun_br.add_flow(table=constants.TUN_TABLE[network_type], priority=1, tun_id=segmentation_id, actions="mod_vlan_vid:%s,resubmit(,%s)" % (lvid, constants.LEARN_FROM_TUN)) if not self.l2_pop or self.l2_pop_regular_mac_learning: learned_flow = ("table=%s," "priority=1," "hard_timeout=300," "NXM_OF_VLAN_TCI[0..11]," "NXM_OF_ETH_DST[]=NXM_OF_ETH_SRC[]," "load:0->NXM_OF_VLAN_TCI[]," "load:NXM_NX_TUN_ID[]->NXM_NX_TUN_ID[]," "output:NXM_OF_IN_PORT[]" % constants.UCAST_TO_TUN) # Once remote mac adresses are learnt, packet is outputed # to patch_int self.tun_br.add_flow(table=constants.LEARN_FROM_TUN, priority=1, actions="learn(%s),output:%s" % (learned_flow, self.patch_int_ofport))
deleted_lines: # inbound from tunnels: set lvid in the right table # and resubmit to Table LEARN_FROM_TUN for mac learning self.tun_br.add_flow(table=constants.TUN_TABLE[network_type], priority=1, tun_id=segmentation_id, actions="mod_vlan_vid:%s,resubmit(,%s)" % (lvid, constants.LEARN_FROM_TUN)) learned_flow = ("table=%s," "priority=1," "hard_timeout=300," "NXM_OF_VLAN_TCI[0..11]," "NXM_OF_ETH_DST[]=NXM_OF_ETH_SRC[]," "load:0->NXM_OF_VLAN_TCI[]," "load:NXM_NX_TUN_ID[]->NXM_NX_TUN_ID[]," "output:NXM_OF_IN_PORT[]" % constants.UCAST_TO_TUN) # Once remote mac adresses are learnt, packet is outputed to patch_int self.tun_br.add_flow(table=constants.LEARN_FROM_TUN, priority=1, actions="learn(%s),output:%s" % (learned_flow, self.patch_int_ofport))

subject: Add cookie support to ovs_lib, ovs_neutron_agent
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-16 22:51:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/dfa348750278c6d1a84dbe6c3a898097c95a87ee', 'message': "Add cookie support to ovs_lib, ovs_neutron_agent

All of the flows on the integration bridge belonging to a vif's
OpenFlow port are removed on port_bound. Since the firewall is invoked
to setup port filters before connectivity is established (i.e. before
port_bound is called) this defeats an OVS-based firewall. To solve
this issue, a distinct cookie on flows that belong to the firewall
and a separate, distinct cookie on flows that belong to the agent
will be used. This will require OVS version 1.5.0+ to delete flows
based on a cookie.

DocImpact: Adds configuration parameter to ovs_neutron_plugin.ini

Change-Id: Ia9b3aa6a383c3465f595725442eca2db05f24a16
Partially-implements: blueprint ovs-firewall-driver

commit_message:
Add cookie support to ovs_lib, ovs_neutron_agent

All of the flows on the integration bridge belonging to a vif's
OpenFlow port are removed on port_bound. Since the firewall is invoked
to setup port filters before connectivity is established (i.e. before
port_bound is called) this defeats an OVS-based firewall. To solve
this issue, a distinct cookie on flows that belong to the firewall
and a separate, distinct cookie on flows that belong to the agent
will be used. This will require OVS version 1.5.0+ to delete flows
based on a cookie.

DocImpact: Adds configuration parameter to ovs_neutron_plugin.ini

Change-Id: Ia9b3aa6a383c3465f595725442eca2db05f24a16
Partially-implements: blueprint ovs-firewall-driver

commit_message:
Assign local VLANs before port filters

Assign local VLANs ahead of establishing port filters so that
actions for OVS flows for security group rules can be appropriately
determined.

Provisioning cannot occur before security group port filters are in
place (connectivity would be established without security!). Also,
assignment must occur before security group port filters are in place
(firewall has to use the local vlan to forward the packet). Thus, the
correct order is to assign, secure, and then provision.

Change-Id: I18f585afc4a342ce97033021a3c3dfb1776695ba
Partially-implements: blueprint ovs-firewall-driver

commit_message:
Move yaql to stackforge

yaql is a library used by at least two Stackforge projects:
Mistral and Murano. Some other OpenStack projects evaluate yaql
for their own needs. Thus it will be beneficial to host yaql on
Stackforge.

Link to github repo:
https://github.com/ativelkov/yaql

Currently project is using standard OpenStack tools such as:
tox, pbr, hacking, testtools, etc

As a first step only docs, pep8 and py27 jobs will run in check
and gate queues. The plan is to run all the python-jobs, publish
docs to rtfd and publish releases to pypi via OpenStack Infra.

Change-Id: I2518fd98078f5e9fae79bbff353d2c184484c8f3

commit_message:
Added source-port-range-{min,max} to sec. groups

Added source-port-range-{min,max} to security groups frontend API and DB. The
attributes are already in the RPC API and are compatible with existing
implementations.

Partially-implements: blueprint ovs-firewall-driver

DocImpact: Adding these parameters to the API via extension requires
documentation changes.

Change-Id: I8cb4f77d847f79dfde7d5cf4a789c19af5c3bc4a

commit_message:
Properly format markdown code blocks

The YAML configuration examples were being parsed as markdown, which
resulted in poorly formatted documents.

Also convert tempest element README file to markdown for consistency.

Change-Id: Id6def1c8bcb86e37f10a74bf85361a9da0d151b6
Closes-Bug: 1328304

commit_message:
Enforce uniqueness of security group name per tenant

In Bug: 1194579 a race condition is described where multiple
requests to create 'default' security group may not be caught
as checks are in code, not enforced on the db model.

This review enforces the uniqueness of {tenant_id, sg_name}
in the SecurityGroup db model using a named UniqueConstraint.
I have included the migration file - please let me know if this
is correct. I don't think we need a test here as this case is
actually already covered in test_extension_security_group

Closes-Bug: 1194579

Change-Id: I9559aeed64942b828ec57611daa780ee6ef5bcb1

commit_message:
maint:Don't translate debug level logs

Our translation policy
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation) calls
for not translating debug level logs. This helps to prioritize log
translation.
There were some commits that fixed it but ignored the the style like
msg = _('this is debug info'); LOG.debug(msg)
This commit fixes this style of LOG.debug.

Change-Id: I2cc3fe563456ba0906f74262ab1ba6967301d6d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/109921/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = ('Join new ServiceGroup member %(member_id)s to the ' '%(group_id)s group, service = %(service)s') msg = ('Explicitly remove the given member %(member_id)s from the' '%(group_id)s group monitoring')
deleted_lines: msg = _('Join new ServiceGroup member %(member_id)s to the ' '%(group_id)s group, service = %(service)s') msg = _('Explicitly remove the given member %(member_id)s from the' '%(group_id)s group monitoring')

subject: Fix KeyError in dhcp_rpc when plugin.port_update raise exception
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-12 12:37:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c943e95b99d5bdba1d71faa12dd9fbddf632e95f', 'message': "Fix KeyError in dhcp_rpc when plugin.port_update raise exception

KeyError exception is seen because of following reasons

* DhcpRpcCallback._port_action() is called by two functions
   -  DhcpRpcCallback.create_dchp_port()
   -  DhcpRpcCallback.update_dhcp_port()

* When create_dhcp_port() function calls _port_action(), the
  function argument 'port' will have the body as
  {'port': {'network_id': foo_network_id, 'fixed_ips': [..] ...}

* When update_dhcp_port() function calls _port_action(), the
  function argument 'port' will have the body as
  {'id': port_id, 'port': {{'port': {'network_id': foo_network_id,
			            'fixed_ips': [..] ...}}

* If an exception occurs when _port_action() calls plugin.create_port(),
  network id is accessed as
  net_id = port['port']['network_id']

* If an exception occurs when _port_action() calls plugin.update_port(),
  network id is accessed as
  net_id = port['port']['network_id']
  which is causing the KeyError. network_id should have been accessed as
  net_id = port['port']['port']['network_id']

This patch fixes the issue by making the _port_action() take the
same port body. update_dhcp_port() insteading of passing the port_id
and port information in a single argument, it now adds port_id
in the port body itself.

Change-Id: I70b92fa20b421b05ca2053a9a57f62db726f7625
Closes-bug: #1378508

same port body. update_dhcp_port() insteading of passing the port_id
and port information in a single argument, it now adds port_id

Change-Id: I70b92fa20b421b05ca2053a9a57f62db726f7625

commit_message:
Fix KeyError in dhcp_rpc when plugin.port_update raise exception

KeyError exception is seen because of following reasons

* DhcpRpcCallback._port_action() is called by two functions
   -  DhcpRpcCallback.create_dchp_port()
   -  DhcpRpcCallback.update_dhcp_port()

* When create_dhcp_port() function calls _port_action(), the
  function argument 'port' will have the body as
  {'port': {'network_id': foo_network_id, 'fixed_ips': [..] ...}

* When update_dhcp_port() function calls _port_action(), the
  function argument 'port' will have the body as
  {'id': port_id, 'port': {{'port': {'network_id': foo_network_id,
			            'fixed_ips': [..] ...}}

* If an exception occurs when _port_action() calls plugin.create_port(),
  network id is accessed as
  net_id = port['port']['network_id']

* If an exception occurs when _port_action() calls plugin.update_port(),
  network id is accessed as
  net_id = port['port']['network_id']
  which is causing the KeyError. network_id should have been accessed as
  net_id = port['port']['port']['network_id']

This patch fixes the issue by making the _port_action() take the
same port body. update_dhcp_port() insteading of passing the port_id
and port information in a single argument, it now adds port_id
in the port body itself.

Change-Id: I70b92fa20b421b05ca2053a9a57f62db726f7625
Closes-bug: #1378508
(cherry picked from commit 7ea605df3ac71dc568194bcd5eaf1c115008e1ee)

commit_message:
Translate 'powervm' hypervisor_type to 'phyp' for scheduling

This adds a temporary translation of the 'powervm' hypervisor type
image metadata to 'phyp' for scheduling.

The powervc-driver in stackforge uses the hypervisor type of 'powervm'
for scheduling so this is needed to make that work until the driver
can get a translation shim in place to convert powervm to phyp in
image metadata.

Closes-Bug: #1370613

Change-Id: I4b20ffcb9911806db821f2902e09248dfa89d845
(cherry picked from commit d05567cc3fcb8849402f7036895ea5f40f7e1a1f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/130235/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_canonicalize_powervm(self): self.assertEqual(hvtype.PHYP, hvtype.canonicalize("POWERVM"))

commit_message:
rootwrap config files reference deleted quantum binaries

dhcp and l3 rootwrap filter files contain reference to the deleted
binary quantum-ns-metadata-proxy. This change removes these obsolete
filters.

Change-Id: Iad4772752d74a1c0535144b5faf9a1f8ae89f6a3
Closes-Bug: #1391256
(cherry picked from commit 226c4f6d809de3d6ed622a1f90b06e34506696d6)

subject: Fix L3 HA network creation to allow user to create router
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-11 13:31:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_ha_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/033e1413fa74a12fc4a0601c42e184317b0586c4', 'message': 'Fix L3 HA network creation to allow user to create router

Update HA Network creation to use an admin context to allow Neutron
to create the tenant-less network required for the HA router when
it does not yet exist and is being created by a non-admin user.

Neutron creates these resources without a tenant so users cannot see
or modify the HA network, ports, etc.  Port creation and association
already use elivated admin contexts to allow their function when
an user attempts to create a HA L3 router.

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_ha_db.py

Change-Id: I36166158a0970b8d08d6702054b11a43fb684281
Closes-Bug: #1388716
(cherry picked from commit cc9bc24229f1d79dc99303db1affc03c030c011e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix L3 HA network creation to allow user to create router

Update HA Network creation to use an admin context to allow Neutron
to create the tenant-less network required for the HA router when
it does not yet exist and is being created by a non-admin user.

Neutron creates these resources without a tenant so users cannot see
or modify the HA network, ports, etc.  Port creation and association
already use elivated admin contexts to allow their function when
an user attempts to create a HA L3 router.

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_ha_db.py

Change-Id: I36166158a0970b8d08d6702054b11a43fb684281
Closes-Bug: #1388716
(cherry picked from commit cc9bc24229f1d79dc99303db1affc03c030c011e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/89/133689/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _create_router(self, ha=True, tenant_id='tenant1', distributed=None, ctx=None): if ctx is None: ctx = self.admin_ctx ctx.tenant_id = tenant_id return self.plugin._create_router_db(ctx, router, tenant_id) def _update_router(self, router_id, ha=True, distributed=None, ctx=None): if ctx is None: ctx = self.admin_ctx return self.plugin._update_router_db(ctx, router_id, class L3HAUserTestCase(L3HATestFramework): def setUp(self): super(L3HAUserTestCase, self).setUp() self.user_ctx = context.Context('', _uuid()) self.plugin = FakeL3Plugin() def test_create_ha_router(self): self._create_router(ctx=self.user_ctx) def test_update_router(self): router = self._create_router(ctx=self.user_ctx) self._update_router(router['id'], ha=False, ctx=self.user_ctx) def test_delete_router(self): router = self._create_router(ctx=self.user_ctx) self.plugin.delete_router(self.user_ctx, router['id'])

commit_message:
Remove openvswitch core plugin entry point

The openvswitch core plugin has been removed but not its associated
"neutron.core_plugins" entry point. This change removes it from
setup.cfg.

Change-Id: I79f7c334cdeb0f4d0d68743734f69c0ec8523467
Related-Bug: #1323729
Closes-Bug: #1391326
(cherry picked from commit f36c29903afb713670f9e7c3f9530e117dfc6bcb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/01/133701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add in-instance docker software config hook

This hook uses 'docker-py' library to deploy containers
for a container-manifest embeded in software-config 'config'
property.

Container manifest uses standard google container manifest schema[1].

WARNING: This is an experimental implementation.

[1]https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/containers/container_vms.

Change-Id: I5ca30e99be1a247daf89c46aaa5a5034f1991379
Closes-Bug: #1380886
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates refs/changes/82/128182/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -x SCRIPTDIR=$(dirname $0) install-packages docker-io if [ -d /etc/systemd/system ]; then systemctl enable docker.service fi pip install docker-py install -D -g root -o root -m 0755 ${SCRIPTDIR}/hook-docker.py /var/lib/heat-config/hooks/docker

subject: Change the periodic tempest "all" job to use neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-11 19:58:25.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/cc82bc5c7ef29896c327479d44ab5ea3dd70968b', 'message': 'Change the periodic tempest "all" job to use neutron

The slow heat job is failing on the nightly tempest 'all' run in the
CfnInitScenarioTest.test_server_cfn_init test, but passes in the
slow heat job. The main differences seem to be that the nightly job runs a lot
more stuff (more stress), and the nightly job uses nova-network but the slow
heat job uses neutron. Changing the 'all' job to neutron will help debug
this and at this point we should be using neutron anyway.

Change-Id: I74afab102c1dcf52aef15b0f4f4f15bbfc08250a
'}]
commit_message:
Change the periodic tempest "all" job to use neutron

The slow heat job is failing on the nightly tempest 'all' run in the
CfnInitScenarioTest.test_server_cfn_init test, but passes in the
slow heat job. The main differences seem to be that the nightly job runs a lot
more stuff (more stress), and the nightly job uses nova-network but the slow
heat job uses neutron. Changing the 'all' job to neutron will help debug
this and at this point we should be using neutron anyway.

Change-Id: I74afab102c1dcf52aef15b0f4f4f15bbfc08250a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/18/133818/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1

subject: Refactor generic cleanup mechanism part 2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-02 02:21:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/c676f4b043d93fdc5ee0b9d73f8d0e6bd819c34f', 'message': "Refactor generic cleanup mechanism part 2

Current cleanup mechanism is awful. It's hardcoed, without repeat on failures,
contains a lot of mistakes, in some places it is too fast (in case of deletion of VMs)
in other to slow (like deletion of users). As well there is mix of cleanup mechanism
and resource cleanup mechanism.
To resolve these all issues this patch introcude a cleanup engine that resolves all issues
above.
It's resource based, so to add new resouce you should just a make subclass of base.Resource
and probably override some of methods like (list, delete, is_deleted) and that's all.
All complexity of managing:
0) waiting unit async deletion is finished
1) repeat on failure logic
2) greaceful failure handling
3) parallelization
4) plugin support
Is hidden deep inside cleanup engine
+ bonus we are able to specify now single resource (without clenaping whole service)

PART 2:
-------

* Write cleanup plugins for all tracked resources (on currnet moment)
* Switch cleanap context to use cleanup engine isntead of ald cleanup.utils
* Merge admin and user cleanup context (cause they are quite short now)
* Change quotas scenairos cleanup context configuration
* Fix resource names that are created by ceilometer scenarios

bp benchmark-context-cleanup-refactor

Change-Id: I85ab881fd65da4bb8263b4f72b9f751673ae5099
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-10 17:49:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/ad84ef61088f478ff7f5fef4b519b8dc892b03c0', 'message': "Refactor generic cleanup mechanism part 2

commit_message:
Refactor generic cleanup mechanism part 2

Current cleanup mechanism is awful. It's hardcoded, without repeat on failures,
contains a lot of mistakes, in some places it is too fast (in case of deletion of VMs)
in other to slow (like deletion of users). As well there is mix of cleanup mechanism
and resource cleanup mechanism.
To resolve these all issues this patch introcude a cleanup engine that resolves all issues
above.
It's resource based, so to add new resouce you should just a make subclass of base.Resource
and probably override some of methods like (list, delete, is_deleted) and that's all.
All complexity of managing:
0) waiting until async deletion is finished
1) repeat on failure logic
2) greaceful failure handling
3) parallelization
4) plugin support
Is hidden deep inside cleanup engine
+ bonus we are able to specify now single resource (without clenaping whole service)

PART 2:
-------

* Write cleanup plugins for all tracked resources (on currnet moment)
* Switch cleanap context to use cleanup engine isntead of ald cleanup.utils
* Merge admin and user cleanup context (cause they are quite short now)
* Change quotas scenairos cleanup context configuration
* Fix resource names that are created by ceilometer scenarios

bp benchmark-context-cleanup-refactor

Change-Id: I85ab881fd65da4bb8263b4f72b9f751673ae5099

added_lines: # Copyright 2014: Mirantis Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from neutronclient.common import exceptions as neutron_exceptions from rally.benchmark.context.cleanup import base from rally.benchmark.context.cleanup import resources from rally.benchmark.scenarios.keystone import utils as keystone_utils from rally import utils from tests.unit import test BASE = "rally.benchmark.context.cleanup.resources" class AllResourceManagerTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_res_manager_special_field(self): for res_mgr in utils.itersubclasses(base.ResourceManager): manager_name = "%s.%s" % (res_mgr.__module__, res_mgr.__name__) fields = filter(lambda x: not x.startswith("__"), dir(res_mgr)) available_opts = set([ "_admin_required", "_perform_for_admin_only", "_service", "_resource", "_order", "_max_attempts", "_timeout", "_interval", "_threads", "_manager", "id", "is_deleted", "delete", "list" ]) extra_opts = set(fields) - available_opts self.assertFalse( extra_opts, ("ResourceManager %(name)s contains extra fields: %(opts)s." " Remove them to pass this test") % {"name": manager_name, "opts": ", ".join(extra_opts)}) class DeletionIsSyncOperationTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_is_deleted(self): self.assertTrue(resources.DeletionIsSyncOperation().is_deleted()) class QuotaMixinTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_id(self): quota = resources.QuotaMixin() quota.raw_resource = mock.MagicMock() self.assertEqual(quota.raw_resource, quota.id()) def test_delete(self): quota = resources.QuotaMixin() mock_manager = mock.MagicMock() quota._manager = lambda: mock_manager quota.raw_resource = mock.MagicMock() quota.delete() mock_manager.delete.assert_called_once_with(quota.raw_resource) def test_list(self): quota = resources.QuotaMixin() quota.tenant_uuid = None self.assertEqual([], quota.list()) quota.tenant_uuid = mock.MagicMock() self.assertEqual([quota.tenant_uuid], quota.list()) class NovaSecurityGroupTestCase(test.TestCase): @mock.patch("%s.base.ResourceManager._manager" % BASE) def test_list(self, mock_manager): secgroups = [mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock()] secgroups[0].name = "a" secgroups[1].name = "b" secgroups[2].name = "default" mock_manager().list.return_value = secgroups self.assertEqual(secgroups[:2], resources.NovaSecurityGroup().list()) class NeutronMixinTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_manager(self): neut = resources.NeutronMixin() neut.user = mock.MagicMock() self.assertEqual(neut.user.neutron.return_value, neut._manager()) def test_id(self): neut = resources.NeutronMixin() neut.raw_resource = {"id": "test"} self.assertEqual("test", neut.id()) def test_delete(self): neut = resources.NeutronMixin() neut.user = mock.MagicMock() neut._resource = "some_resource" neut.raw_resource = {"id": "42"} neut.delete() neut.user.neutron().delete_some_resource.assert_called_once_with("42") def test_list(self): neut = resources.NeutronMixin() neut.user = mock.MagicMock() neut._resource = "some_resource" neut.tenant_uuid = "user_tenant" some_resources = [{"tenant_id": neut.tenant_uuid}, {"tenant_id": "a"}] neut.user.neutron().list_some_resources.return_value = { "some_resources": some_resources } self.assertEqual([some_resources[0]], neut.list()) neut.user.neutron().list_some_resources.assert_called_once_with( {"tenant_id": neut.tenant_uuid}) class NeutronPortTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_delete(self): raw_res = {"device_owner": "abbabaab", "id": "some_id"} user = mock.MagicMock() resources.NeutronPort(resource=raw_res, user=user).delete() user.neutron().delete_port.assert_called_once_with(raw_res["id"]) def test_delete_port_raise_exception(self): raw_res = {"device_owner": "abbabaab", "id": "some_id"} user = mock.MagicMock() user.neutron().delete_port.side_effect = ( neutron_exceptions.PortNotFoundClient) resources.NeutronPort(resource=raw_res, user=user).delete() user.neutron().delete_port.assert_called_once_with(raw_res["id"]) def test_delete_port_device_owner(self): raw_res = { "device_owner": "network:router_interface", "id": "some_id", "device_id": "dev_id" } user = mock.MagicMock() resources.NeutronPort(resource=raw_res, user=user).delete() user.neutron().remove_interface_router.assert_called_once_with( raw_res["device_id"], {"port_id": raw_res["id"]}) class GlanceImageTestCase(test.TestCase): @mock.patch("%s.GlanceImage._manager" % BASE) def test_list(self, mock_manager): glance = resources.GlanceImage() glance.tenant_uuid = mock.MagicMock() mock_manager().list.return_value = ["a", "b", "c"] self.assertEqual(["a", "b", "c"], glance.list()) mock_manager().list.assert_called_once_with(owner=glance.tenant_uuid) class CeliometerTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_id(self): ceil = resources.CeliometerAlarms() ceil.raw_resource = mock.MagicMock() self.assertEqual(ceil.raw_resource.alarm_id, ceil.id()) @mock.patch("%s.CeliometerAlarms._manager" % BASE) def test_list(self, mock_manager): ceil = resources.CeliometerAlarms() ceil.tenant_uuid = mock.MagicMock() mock_manager().list.return_value = ["a", "b", "c"] mock_manager.reset_mock() self.assertEqual(["a", "b", "c"], ceil.list()) mock_manager().list.assert_called_once_with( q=[{"field": "project_id", "op": "eq", "value": ceil.tenant_uuid}]) class ZaqarQueuesTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_delete(self): zaqar = resources.ZaqarQueues() zaqar.raw_resource = mock.MagicMock() msgs = [mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock()] msgs[0].delete.return_value = True msgs[1].delete.side_effect = [Exception, Exception, True] msgs[2].delete.side_effect = [Exception] * 10 zaqar.raw_resource.messages.list.return_value = msgs zaqar.delete() zaqar.raw_resource.messages.list.assert_called_once_with() zaqar.raw_resource.delete.assert_called_once_with() msgs[0].delete.assert_called_once_with() msgs[1].delete.assert_has_calls([mock.call()] * 3) msgs[2].delete.assert_has_calls([mock.call()] * 3) class KeystoneMixinTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_is_deleted(self): self.assertTrue(resources.KeystoneMixin().is_deleted()) @mock.patch("%s.keystone_wrapper.wrap" % BASE) def test_manager(self, mock_wrap): keystone_mixin = resources.KeystoneMixin() keystone_mixin.admin = mock.MagicMock() self.assertEqual(mock_wrap.return_value, keystone_mixin._manager()) mock_wrap.assert_called_once_with( keystone_mixin.admin.keystone.return_value) @mock.patch("%s.keystone_wrapper.wrap" % BASE) def test_delete(self, mock_wrap): keystone_mixin = resources.KeystoneMixin() keystone_mixin._resource = "some_resource" keystone_mixin.id = lambda: "id_a" keystone_mixin.admin = mock.MagicMock() keystone_mixin.delete() mock_wrap.assert_called_once_with( keystone_mixin.admin.keystone.return_value) mock_wrap().delete_some_resource.assert_called_once_with("id_a") @mock.patch("%s.keystone_wrapper.wrap" % BASE) def test_list(self, mock_wrap): keystone_mixin = resources.KeystoneMixin() keystone_mixin._resource = "some_resource2" keystone_mixin.admin = mock.MagicMock() result = [mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock()] prefix = keystone_utils.KeystoneScenario.RESOURCE_NAME_PREFIX result[0].name = prefix + "keystone-a" result[1].name = prefix + "keystone-b" result[2].name = "not_a_keystone_pattern" mock_wrap().list_some_resource2s.return_value = result self.assertEqual(result[:2], keystone_mixin.list()) mock_wrap().list_some_resource2s.assert_called_once_with()

commit_message:
Updated berkshelf to 3.1.5, chefspec to 4.0.0 and foodcritic to 4.0

* Updated berkshelf from 2.0.18 to 3.1.5 in Gemfile
* added supermarket source to Berksfile
* some refactoring of the Berksfile
* removed Gemfile.lock since its not supposed to be in master branches
* also updated chefspec to 4 and foodcritic to 4 (like done some time ago for the other cookbooks)

Change-Id: I787912448337040ccf26a1126d848c76e7148caf
Implements: blueprint update-berkshelf

commit_message:
Spec for keypair X509 public key certificates

Introduction of X509 public key certificates keypair support in the Nova
API.

bp keypair-x509-certificates

Change-Id: I0559d4bd727219dd5ed2783731aefdcc91f5a449
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/34/105034/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================ Keypair support for X509 public key certificates ================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/keypair-x509-certificates Introduction of X509 public key certificates keypair support in the Nova API. Problem description =================== Nova keypairs are mostly used by Linux guests to handle user authentication via SSH public key authentication without incurring in the management and security overhead that passwords require. Public keys are provided to the guests as part of the metadata and included in the guest configuration by tools like cloud-init. Windows operating systems don't support natively SSH and thus authentication requires the usage of passwords unless the image deployer chooses to include a 3rd party unsupported SSH service port, which implies incurring in potential security and support issues. Windows supports natively password-less authentication for WinRM by using X509 certificates in place of SSH keys, including PowerShell remoting as detailed here: http://www.cloudbase.it/windows-without-passwords-in-openstack/ From a practical perspective, X509 certificates are used by WinRM in a way which can be considered consistent with the usage of SSH keys on Linux, as both are based on public / private keypairs. For simplicity, since WinRM can be configured to accept self signed certificates, we will omit the implications of certificate chain validation. Proposed change =============== While Nova currently supports SSH keypairs only, the API can be extended to support x509 certificates, while maintaining full backwards compatibility. The areas that require changes are: * Nova API (v2 and v3), to accept the certificate type as an option (defaulting to SSH if not provided) * The nova.compute.api.KeypairAPI class to be able to generate and manage X509 certificates beside the existing SSH case * nova.objects.Keypair class to add a type property * Related database migration * Nova metadata API to support an additional x509 content in nova.api.metadata.base.InstanceMetadata() * python-novaclient to add the optional keypair type option Usage examples Generating an x509 keypair via CLI and saving the private certificate locally (in PKCS#12 format): nova keypair-add keypair1 --keypair-type x509 Importing an x509 public key certificate: nova keypair-add keypair1 --keypair-type x509 --pub-key \ /path/to/PEM_encoded_public_certificate The certificate type could be discovered by examining the content without requiring the user to provide it explicitly. For backwards compatibility, omitting the certificate type results in a SSH certificate: nova keypair-add keypair2 --pub-key /path/to/SSH_pub_key equivalent to: nova keypair-add keypair2 --keypair-type SSH --pub-key /path/to/SSH_pub_key On the metadata side ssh keys and x509 keys are provided separately for backwards compatibility: "public_keys": {"keypair2": "ssh-rsa AAAAB3...cyJvOQ== Generated by Nova\n"}, "x509": {"keypair1": "MIIDaTC...ysk8w==\n"}, The -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- / -----END CERTIFICATE----- header and footer can be omitted Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- nova.objects.Keypair requires an additional type property REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: cbelu Other contributors: alexpilotti Work Items ---------- * Nova feature implementation * Unit tests Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests. Specific Tempest tests can be added as well. Documentation Impact ==================== The Nova driver documentation for nova keypair API and CLI commands usage need to be updated. References ========== * Initial discussion (Juno design summit): https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-hyperv-juno * Windows authentication without passwords in OpenStack http://www.cloudbase.it/windows-without-passwords-in-openstack/ * An introduction to WinRM basics http://blogs.technet.com/b/askperf/archive/2010/09/24/an-introduction-to-winrm-basics.aspx

commit_message:
Run puppet unit tests on newer 3.x series versions

Puppet has advanced beyond 3.4. This adds tests to be run
in 3.6 and 3.7. 3.7 will be the last 3.x release. We don't need
to test 3.5 because it only existed for 2 weeks and was replaced
quickly by 3.6 because of some terrible bugs. Verion 3.3 is the
oldest puppet we will test against.

Discussion here http://tinyurl.com/ocsz4hj

Change-Id: I59d55f2a7e796087fb614788b76f62d09a13f729

commit_message:
Break V2 XML Support

DO NOT MERGE: First patch to see if this breaks XML support in a clean
way.

Nova's XML support has been deprecated with a warning that it could be
removed as early as Juno. Now that we are in Kilo we are ready to remove
support.  Before actually doing the surgery to properly remove XML
support, intentionally break XML support in a 'clean' way, so if someone
freaks out that we are removing XML support we can easily re-enable it.

Follow up to I4acc15ce5f487738bb34a95c2261a5d05d827d8d

Change-Id: I345ce62ab0cd6fde07338831b5675a23c94478c7

commit_message:
Let image upload happen after configuration is applied

In order to succesfully upload an image, it is important that the server side
got a chance to react to possibly updated configuration. The Glance_image class
itself also parses the configuration of the API service for stuff such as region
name. When any of these options are changed through the Glance_api_config, this
modification has to be saved on disk at the time the Glance_image class parses
the configuration file.

This patch utilizes the transitivity of the ~> operator where a change to a
Glance_api_config already notifies the Service['glance-api'].

Change-Id: I21d7c40de79b5e40421f9d645236ee972bd061e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/42/125242/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set nginx default settings for master node

- increase number of workers from 2 to half available CPUs.
- enable epoll by default
- enable tcpnopush
- enable tcpnodelay
- disable server_token

These settings allow to bootstrap many nodes in parallel allowing
anaconda and debian installer to get all files without timeout.

Partial-Bug: 1384510
Partial-Bug: 1349360

Change-Id: I44054cf2afa1fa5a70ba064f4957b964947b2b2c
Implements: blueprint 100-nodes-support
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

added_lines: user nginx; worker_processes <%= [[@processorcount.to_i, 2].min, @processorcount.to_i / 2].max %>; error_log /var/log/nginx/error.log; pid /var/run/nginx.pid; events { worker_connections 1024; use epoll; } http { include /etc/nginx/mime.types; default_type application/octet-stream; log_format main '$remote_addr - $remote_user [$time_local] "$request" ' '$status $body_bytes_sent "$http_referer" ' '"$http_user_agent" "$http_x_forwarded_for"'; access_log /var/log/nginx/access.log main; sendfile on; tcp_nopush on; # don't buffer data-sends (disable Nagle algorithm). # Good for sending frequent small bursts of data in real time. tcp_nodelay on; #keepalive_timeout 0; keepalive_timeout 65; server_tokens off; #gzip on; # Load config files from the /etc/nginx/conf.d directory # The default server is in conf.d/default.conf include /etc/nginx/conf.d/*.conf; }

commit_message:
Upgrade to pylint >=1.3.0

The .pylintrc used for neutron refers to checks added in pylint 1.3.0,
and aborts on earlier versions (from a quick experiment).

This change moves global requirements to pylint>=1.3.0.

Change-Id: I2795214f90c2338ef968210432565a978c1d636b

commit_message:
Add service_identity to openstacklib

The openstacklib::service_validation resource is a library resource that can
be used by nova, cinder, ceilometer, etc., rather than replicating equivalent
functionality across all of these modules to manage Keystone resources
like user, tenant, service, and endpoints.

Change-Id: Ice459f1048d6aa6d408f62517f13a83356f815f9
Implements: blueprint common-openstack-identity-resource
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/87/132487/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #### Defined type: openstacklib::service_identity The service_identity resource is a library resource that can be used by nova, cinder, ceilometer, etc., to create Keystone resources like users, roles, tenants, endpoints, services. Typically this resource will be declared with a notify parameter to restart the OpenStack API service when the service_identity resource is changed. For example, in neutron::keystone::auth you might declare: ::openstacklib::service_identity { 'neutron': password => 'secrete', auth_name => $auth_name, service_name => $service_name, service_type => $service_type, service_desc => $service_desc, email => $email, tenant => $tenant, region => $region, admin_url => $admin_url internal_url => $internal_url public_url => $public_url configure_endpoint => $configure_endpoint, configure_user => $configure_user, configure_user_role => $configure_user_role, notify => Service['neutron-server'], } ** Parameters for openstacklib::service_identity: ** #####`password` Password to create for the service user; string; required #####`auth_name` The name of the service user; string; optional; default to the $title of the resource, i.e. 'nova' #####`service_name` Name of the service; string; required #####`service_type` Type of the service; string; required #####`service_desc` Description of the service; string; optional: default to '$name service' #####`public_url` Public endpoint URL; string; required #####`internal_url` Internal endpoint URL; string; required #####`admin_url` Admin endpoint URL; string; required #####`region` Endpoint region; string; optional: default to 'RegionOne' #####`tenant` Service tenant; string; optional: default to 'services' #####`domain` User domain (keystone v3); string; optional: default to undef #####`email` Service email; string; optional: default to '$auth_name@localhost' #####`configure_endpoint` Whether to create the endpoint. string; optional: default to True #####`configure_user` Whether to create the user. string; optional: default to True #####`configure_user_role Whether to create the user role. string; optional: default to True

commit_message:
Allow to use custom mirror

The current configure_mirror.sh expects no-one
want to use other than openstack.org pypi mirrors.

Having the configure_mirror.sh to use a costum,
NODEPOOL_PYPI_MIRROR instead of NODEPOOL_REGION when defined.

It allows averyone to use his local pypi mirror, with his
nodepool.

Change-Id: I6f0bd3372be09ccf423caacff83e615038c96ec5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/78/131878/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NODEPOOL_PYPI_MIRROR=${NODEPOOL_PYPI_MIRROR:-http://pypi.$NODEPOOL_REGION.openstack.org/simple} index-url = $NODEPOOL_PYPI_MIRRORindex_url = $NODEPOOL_PYPI_MIRROR
deleted_lines: index-url = http://pypi.$NODEPOOL_REGION.openstack.org/simpleindex_url = http://pypi.$NODEPOOL_REGION.openstack.org/simple

Adds admin permissions to #openstack-sprint

We created a new OpenStack IRC channel #openstack-sprint, for
working on virtual sprints. This patch adds admin permissions
to the channel.

commit_message:
Add new Distil project

Distil is a rating service of OpenStack to provide easy
interactions with user's existing billing systems, by
exposing a configurable set of collection tools and
transformers to make usable rating data out of Ceilometer
entries.

commit_message:
Check stunnel.connect_host not stunnel.connect_ip

The various service configurations all check for
stunnel.connect_ip as part of the configuration for
enabling stunnel. This variable doesn't exist in any
template. However stunnel.connect_host exists in
ssl_source.yaml

Change-Id: Iee4dd33d5afde211f669346005c36f88c9ebeae2
Depends-On: I25c4bb09cf28a3728e959d4dd583af26a602ad90
Closes-Bug: #1391926

deleted_lines: {{#stunnel.connect_ip}} bind_host = {{stunnel.connect_ip}} registry_host = {{stunnel.connect_ip}} {{/stunnel.connect_ip}} {{^stunnel.connect_ip}}{{/stunnel.connect_ip}}

commit_message:
Removes docimpactgroup: openstack-manuals for select Oslo repos

- Only config items contain doc impact for openstack-manuals.
- Otherwise Oslo is for contributor devs and we do not
track those in the openstack-manuals Launchpad project.

Change-Id: I42f8b00c8593018b61835fcdab5986336552ce67

commit_message:
disable services in sahara-image-elements

We added hive-metastore, hive-server2, hue, and
spark-history-server services to chkconfig off list, to avoid
possible erros during cluster creating.

Closes-Bug: #1391121
Change-Id: Ie8b7176173bdc90806a9f528c4f575e7fb147dfa
